docs.title: Match Official System Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the Match Official System user guide. Whether you're a match official tracking your development, a reviewer providing feedback, or an administrator managing your organisation, this documentation will help you get the most out of the system.

docs.title: What You Can Do
docs.text:
The Match Official System is a comprehensive platform designed to support professional development and performance management for match officials and related personnel.

Track Your Development Create and manage diary entries to record daily observations, match assessments, and personal development goals. Request feedback from reviewers and track your progress over time with seasonal reviews and performance analytics.

Manage Assessments & Exams Complete online exams with secure question banks, receive detailed feedback on your performance, and monitor your assessment history. Reviewers can provide structured feedback using customised rating scales and comment fields.

Collaborate & Communicate Access news and announcements from your organisation, upload and share files through a centralised library, and connect with colleagues by searching the user directory.

Administer Your Organisation Configure how your group uses the system by setting up assessment templates, managing user access levels, creating competitions, and analysing group performance through detailed reporting dashboards.

docs.title: Roles and Access
docs.text:
• Owner: Full administrative control of the group. Can manage members, settings, and all features.
  • Viewer: Can create assessments on other users and view subgroup folders (read-only).
  • Reviewer: Can review diary and plan entries, run reports, and view subgroup folders (read-only).
  • Trainer: Can manage exams (group-level only).
  • Communications: Can manage news articles (group-level only).
  • Files Manager: Can upload, delete, and organise files and folders.
  • User: Standard member with personal workspace access. No administrative roles.

docs.title: Organizations and Groups
docs.text:
• Group/Association: Your primary organisation within MOS. Many features (News, Reports, Assessments) are scoped to an association.
  • Subgroup: A subdivision within an association used for targeting (e.g., region, squad, team). Membership in subgroups controls visibility of targeted content like News.

docs.title: Assessments and Performance
docs.text:
• Assessment: A review or evaluation of match official performance created by reviewers based on match observations.
  • Diary Entry: A personal record of a match created by an official. Contains observations and self-reflection.
  • Plan: A development or training plan. Includes goals, actions, and timeframes.
  • Assessments: Evaluations such as exams or reviews completed by members within the system.

docs.title: Content and Communication
docs.text:
• News: Articles posted by admins for the association and its subgroups. Sorted by last updated; paged with a Show more button.
  • Email-to-News: Sending an email to a designated mailbox (shown on the News page for admins) to create an article. Subject is the title, body is the content, and attachments are added.

docs.title: Files and Media
docs.text:
• Attachments: Files associated with a record (e.g., News, Media). May be stored in Azure Blob Storage or local uploads, with links routed through file.aspx.
  • Media Library: Read-only browsing of media (e.g., videos, images) linked to reviews/assessments.
  • Folders (File Manager): Admin-facing area for creating, uploading, moving, and sharing files/folders.
  • Share Link: A predefined or generated URL that provides access to a file or resource, sometimes with restricted scope/time.

docs.title: System Features
docs.text:
• Sanitization: Unsafe HTML is removed before rendering to protect users. Links are preserved where possible.
  • Time-ago Display: Relative time formatting for dates (e.g., "Last updated 2 hours ago").
  • Data Storage: All data is stored securely in Microsoft Azure in the Australia Southeast region, ensuring data residency compliance.
  • Microsoft Azure AD B2C: Microsoft's cloud-based authentication and identity management service used by Match Official System. Enables secure sign-in with email/password or social providers (Microsoft, Google), password recovery with security questions, and account linking for multiple login methods.

docs.text: The Match Official System is a platform for managing match officials, assessments, training, and professional development. It provides tools for recording match diaries, receiving feedback, and communicating with your association.

docs.title: What Is the Match Official System?
docs.text:
The Match Official System helps associations and match officials work together effectively by providing:

  • Personal dashboard showing your activity and upcoming tasks
  • Assessment and diary management for match officials
  • Training plan tracking and development goals
  • News and announcements from your association
  • Document and media library for sharing resources

Reviewers

Same as viewers, plus:

  • Track development progress
  • Support continuous improvement

  • Publish news and announcements
  • Create and assign assessments
  • Generate reports
  • Configure association settings

Access Level

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Assessment Templates allow you to customise how your users complete different types of assessments. You can configure the layout, fields, ratings, comments, and instructions for diary entries, match day assessments, season reviews, media entries, custom assessments, and peer reviews.

Each assessment type can be tailored to your organisation's specific needs with custom descriptions, detail fields, and administrative instructions.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text:
1. From the main menu, click Admin
  2. Click Assessment Templates

The page shows tabs for Assessments and Plans. Assessment Templates are under the Assessments tab.

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
• You must have administrator access
  • Changes to templates apply to all new assessments created after the changes
  • Existing assessments keep their original template format
  • You can have up to 20 rating options and 10 comment fields per assessment type
  • All text fields support formatted text with descriptions

Template Archiving and Historical Data

When you modify a template, the previous version is automatically archived to keep historical data intact for accurate reporting. However, frequently changing templates can create many archived versions and impact your experience seeing all the data in one view/snapshot.

Best practice: Design your templates carefully before implementation. Make changes sparingly to avoid breaking up your datasets for reporting. If you need a significantly different template, consider waiting until the end of season/year before changing as to avoid a break in reporting over that period.

docs.title: Assessments Tab
docs.text: The Assessments tab contains templates for six assessment types. Each can be customised independently.

docs.title: Diary Template
docs.text:
Diary entries are day-by-day assessments created by users.

Configure diary days:

  1. Under the Diary tab, find "Number of days on the entry?"
  2. Select 1 to 5 days from the dropdown
  3. Users can enter observations for each selected day

Control user access to diary features:

  1. "Allow users to request review?" - Set to Yes or No
  2. "User can see ratings section?" - Set to Yes or No
  3. "User can see comments section?" - Set to Yes or No

Configure administrator visibility:

  1. "Admin ratings section?" - Select:
    • Yes, response shared with user - Admins can rate and users see the ratings
    • Yes, response not shared with user - Admins can rate but users don't see them
    • No, cannot access - Admins cannot see user responses
  2. "Admin comments section?" - Select same three options

Add descriptions for users:

  1. In the "Diary description the user sees" field, enter text that explains how to complete the diary
  2. In the "Diary description the administrator sees" field, enter guidance for admins reviewing diaries
  3. In the "Diary description the user sees when reviewed" field, enter what users see after their diary is reviewed

Add custom detail fields:

Diary entries include three hardcoded fields that are always present:

  • Team A - First team name (autocomplete enabled)
  • Team B - Second team name (autocomplete enabled)
  • Venue - Location of the diary entry (autocomplete enabled)

These three fields automatically provide suggestions as users type, based on previously used teams and venues in your group. Users can select from suggestions or enter a new name.

You can add up to 6 additional custom detail fields (Detail 1 through Detail 6):

  1. Under "Details" section, you see 6 detail fields available
  2. For each detail field, enter:
    • A field label (e.g., "Objectives achieved")
    • Instructions for users
  3. Leave blank to hide the field
  4. Each detail field becomes a section in the diary entry form

Overall comment box for reviews:

When a diary is reviewed by an administrator or reviewer, they can enter feedback in: - Ratings section - Individual ratings for specific performance areas - Comments section - Individual comments for each comment field - Overall comment box - A free-text box for general feedback that's not tied to any specific field

Users see all admin feedback after the review is completed.

Save your changes:

  1. After all changes, click Save assessment design at the bottom
  2. Result: New diary entries show your updated template

docs.title: Match Day Template
docs.text:
Match day assessments are observations about specific matches or events.

Configure match day days:

  1. Under the Match Day tab, find "Number of days on the entry?"
  2. Select 1 to 5 days from the dropdown

Control ratings and comments:

  1. "Show ratings section?" - Select:
    • Yes, response shared with user - Visible to users
    • Yes, response not shared with user - Admin only
    • No - Not shown
  2. "Show comments section?" - Select same three options

Add descriptions:

  1. In "Match Day description for the administrators" field, enter admin guidance
  2. In "Match Day description the user sees when submitted" field, enter what users see after submission

Add detail fields:

Match day assessments include three hardcoded fields that are always present: - Team A - First team name (autocomplete enabled) - Team B - Second team name (autocomplete enabled) - Venue - Location of the match (autocomplete enabled)

These three fields automatically provide suggestions as users type, based on previously used teams and venues in your group.

You can add up to 6 additional custom detail fields (Detail 1 through Detail 6):

  1. Enter labels for each custom detail field
  2. Leave blank to hide a field
  3. Common examples:
    • Detail 1: "In-game decisions"
    • Detail 2: "Communication"
    • Detail 3: "Positioning"
    • Detail 4: "Game awareness"
    • Detail 5: "Player management"
    • Detail 6: "Overall performance"

Overall comment box for reviews:

When a match day assessment is reviewed, reviewers can enter: - Specific ratings and comments for individual fields - An overall comment box for general feedback on the match assessment

Save your changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Season Template
docs.text:
Season templates are for longer-term seasonal reviews or summaries.

Add detail fields:

  1. Enter labels and instructions for all 6 detail fields available
  2. Examples:
    • Detail 1: Seasonal achievements
    • Detail 2: Areas for development
    • Detail 3: Goals for next season
    • Detail 4: Performance highlights
    • Detail 5: Learning outcomes
    • Detail 6: Additional comments

Save your changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Media Template
docs.text:
Media templates are for entries containing video, image, or other media content.

Add detail fields:

Media assessments include two hardcoded fields that are always present: - Team A - First team name (autocomplete enabled) - Team B - Second team name (autocomplete enabled)

These fields automatically provide suggestions as users type, based on previously used teams in your group.

You can also add labels for all 6 detail fields:

  1. Enter labels for detail fields you want to use
  2. Leave blank to hide unused detail fields
  3. Examples:
    • Detail 1: Media description
    • Detail 2: Key moments
    • Detail 3: Analysis
    • Detail 4: Technical aspects
    • Detail 5: Performance feedback
    • Detail 6: Recommendations

Save your changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Custom Template
docs.text:
Custom templates are for unique assessment types specific to your organisation.

Add detail fields:

  1. Enter labels for all 6 custom detail fields
  2. Customise these fields for your specific needs

Save your changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Peer Template
docs.text:
Peer assessments allow officials to review each other.

Configure peer days:

  1. Under the Peer tab, find "Number of days on the entry?"
  2. Select 1 to 5 days

Control ratings and comments:

  1. "Show ratings section?" - Select visibility level
  2. "Show comments section?" - Select visibility level

Add descriptions:

  1. In "Peer description for the administrators" field, enter admin guidance
  2. In "Peer description the user sees when submitted" field, enter user-facing text

Add detail fields:

Peer assessments include three hardcoded fields: - Peer name - Name of the person being reviewed - Event/Match - The event or match being assessed - Date - Date of the event

You can add up to 6 additional custom detail fields (Detail 1 through Detail 6):

  1. Enter labels for each custom detail field
  2. Examples:
    • Detail 1: "Technical competency"
    • Detail 2: "Decision making"
    • Detail 3: "Communication"
    • Detail 4: "Positioning and movement"
    • Detail 5: "Game awareness"
    • Detail 6: "Match intensity"

Overall comment box for peer reviews:

When a peer assessment is submitted, the reviewer can enter: - Individual ratings and comments for each field - An overall comment box for general feedback about the peer

Save your changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Plans Tab
docs.text:
The Plans tab contains templates for plan-type entries that users create for development and goal planning.

Plans follow a similar structure to assessments with customisable detail fields and comment sections. Configure plan templates in the same way as assessments by:

  1. Clicking the Plans tab at the top of the Assessment Templates page
  2. Selecting each plan type from the left sidebar
  3. Adding custom detail fields and descriptions
  4. Configuring visibility and permissions
  5. Clicking Save to apply changes

Plans are typically used for: - Development goals and planning - Performance improvement plans - Seasonal planning - Personal development objectives

docs.title: Ratings
docs.text:
Create custom rating scales used across your assessments. These appear as options when admins and users complete assessments.

View all ratings:

  1. Click the Ratings tab
  2. You see a table of all available ratings for your group

Add a new rating:

  1. In the "Add a new rating" section, enter a rating option (e.g., "Excellent", "Good", "Needs Improvement")
  2. Click Add rating
  3. The rating is available in all assessment forms

Edit a rating:

  1. Click Edit next to the rating
  2. Change the rating text
  3. Click Update

Delete a rating:

  1. Click Delete next to the rating
  2. The rating is removed from all future assessments

docs.title: Competitions
docs.text:
Create a list of competitions or events for your group. These can be referenced in assessments and reports.

View all competitions:

  1. Click the Competitions tab
  2. You see a table of all competitions

Add a new competition:

  1. In the "Add a new competition" section, enter the competition name
  2. Click Add competition
  3. The competition is available for selection in assessment entries

Edit a competition:

  1. Click Edit next to the competition
  2. Change the competition name and rest days if needed
  3. Click Update

Delete a competition:

  1. Click Delete next to the competition
  2. The competition is removed from the system

docs.title: Ratings and Comments Configuration
docs.text:
Each assessment type can have customised rating scales and comment fields. These are configured separately for each assessment type.

For Diary assessments:

  1. Scroll to the Diary template section
  2. You see 20 rating options (Rating 1 through Rating 20)
  3. For each rating option, enter the rating label (e.g., "Positioning", "Decision making", "Communication")
  4. Below the ratings, enter 10 comment field labels (Comment 1 through Comment 10)
  5. For each comment field, enter a label and description
  6. Examples:
    • Comment 1: Strengths
    • Comment 2: Areas for improvement
    • Comment 3: Development goals

Apply the same process for:

  • Match Day assessments (ratings and comments)
  • Other assessment types that support ratings and comments

Save all changes:

  1. Click Save assessment design at the bottom of the page
  2. Result: Your custom ratings and comments appear in all new assessments

docs.title: Create a custom diary template for your organisation
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Assessment Templates
  2. Click the Assessments tab, then Diary
  3. Set the number of days (e.g., 3 days)
  4. Enable ratings and comments for both users and admins
  5. Enter a description for users: "Complete your daily assessment including key observations, decisions, and areas for improvement"
  6. Enter admin description: "Review the diary entry and provide constructive feedback using the ratings and comments sections"
  7. For Detail 1: Enter "Key decisions"
  8. For Detail 2: Enter "Performance observations"
  9. For Detail 3: Enter "Areas for development"

docs.title: Changes to assessment template not appearing
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You modified a template but existing assessments don't show changes
  • New assessments show old format

How to fix

  1. Go back to Assessment Templates
  2. Verify you clicked Save assessment design
  3. Clear your browser cache
  4. Create a new assessment and check if the template applied
  5. Existing assessments keep their original format; only new ones use updated templates

Common causes

  • Forgot to save changes
  • Browser cache showing old version
  • Changes apply only to new assessments, not existing ones

docs.title: Rating not appearing in assessment form
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You added a rating but users don't see it
  • Rating selection dropdown is missing

How to fix

  1. Go to Assessment Templates
  2. Click the Ratings tab
  3. Verify the rating appears in the table
  4. If missing, add it again by entering the rating name and clicking Add rating
  5. Go back to the assessment form and refresh the page

Common causes

  • Rating wasn't saved
  • Browser cache issue

docs.title: Detail fields not appearing in the form
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You entered detail field labels but they don't show in the assessment form
  • Form appears incomplete

How to fix

  1. Go to Assessment Templates
  2. Click the relevant assessment type (Diary, Match Day, etc.)
  3. Verify you entered text in the Detail fields (Details 1-6)
  4. Check that you clicked Save assessment design
  5. Create a new assessment and verify the fields appear

Common causes

  • Detail fields were left blank (they're hidden when empty)
  • Changes weren't saved
  • Browser cache

docs.title: Cannot save assessment design
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Error message when you click Save assessment design
  • Page doesn't save changes

How to fix

  1. Verify you have administrator access
  2. Check that you've entered valid information in all fields
  3. Try saving again
  4. If the problem continues, check browser console for errors
  5. Contact your system administrator

Common causes

  • Invalid text in description fields
  • Browser compatibility issue
  • Administrator access expired

docs.title: Admin: View Assessments and Plans
docs.text:
Access Level

Viewer, Reviewer, or Owner access required

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
View assessments and plans for members in your group. What you see and can do depends on your role:

  • Viewers see all assessment types (diary, match day, season, media, custom, peer reviews), can create assessments on other users, but cannot reassign entries, change reviewers or review diary entries
  • Reviewers see diary entries only and can reassign entries and change assigned reviewers
  • Users with both Viewer and Reviewer roles see all assessment types, can review/create all assessment types and can reassign and change reviewers
  • Owners have full access including viewing all types, reassigning, changing reviewers, declining reviews, deleting entries, and using bulk actions

This page shows match assessments, diary entries, seasonal reviews, and goal setting plans. You can search by member name and view assessment details including ratings and comments. See Access Control by Role for full details.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text:
From the sidebar, click Assessments to expand the menu, then:

  • View assessments or View plans to see all entries
  • Diary entries or Plan entries to review items awaiting your feedback (Reviewer role required)
  • Match day, Media, Season, or Custom to create new assessments on other users (Viewer role required)

docs.title: Assessment Types
docs.text:
The system supports different assessment types based on templates set up in your group settings. Each type may show different sections, ratings, and feedback fields.

Type Purpose Diary Observational entry with ratings and comments about a single event or day. Match Day Review Standardised single‑match template for focussed match feedback and ratings. Season Review End‑of‑season summary capturing trends, overall ratings, and recommendations. Media Review Assessment centred on media (video/audio) analysis and timestamped commentary. Custom Review Group‑configured template(s); sections and fields defined by the group — only relevant sections appear when viewing. Peer Review Feedback provided by colleagues/peers, typically reciprocal and discussion‑oriented. Diary (Draft) Diary entry in draft status. Reviewers can provide feedback as a draft review without publishing it. The creator remains able to edit.

When you view an assessment, only the sections relevant to that type appear.

docs.title: Draft
docs.text:
• Entry created but not yet sent to a reviewer
  • Only the person who created it.
  • You can reassign it to another user
  • You can change the reviewer
  • You can delete it

docs.title: Awaiting Review
docs.text:
• Sent to a reviewer
  • The assigned reviewer has not yet completed it
  • You can still change the reviewer
  • You can decline the review (sends it back to Draft/Confidential)
  • You can reassign to a different user

docs.title: Reviewed
docs.text:
• The reviewer has completed the assessment
  • The subject can see it
  • You can click to open and view all reviewer feedback, ratings, and comments
  • You can reassign to a different user
  • You can change the reviewer if needed
  • You cannot decline (already completed)

docs.title: Assessment Replied
docs.text:
• The user or peer recipient has submitted feedback in response to a reviewed assessment
  • This indicates the user or peer has replied to reviewer feedback
  • For assessments: The assessment feedback appears in a highlighted section when you view the assessment
  • For peer reviews: The recipient's feedback response appears in a highlighted section
  • You can view the feedback/response but cannot edit or delete it
  • The reply is read-only

docs.title: View-Only Assessments
docs.text:
• These are shared for viewing only
  • The reviewer cannot add new ratings or feedback
  • Subject can read the entry but reviewers cannot edit it

docs.title: How to Find Assessments and Plans
View All Assessments
docs.text:
1. Click Admin then View assessments and plans
  2. The page shows all assessment and diary entries for your group
  3. Entries are listed in a table with member name, match details, and status

docs.title: View All Plans
docs.text:
1. Click Admin then View assessments and plans
  2. Click the Plans tab
  3. Plans appear in a table with member name, plan type, assigned reviewer, and status

docs.title: What You See in the Table
docs.text:
Each row shows:

  • Member name: The person who created or was assigned the entry
  • Match or plan details: For assessments, the teams/venue; for plans, the plan type
  • Reviewer: Who is assigned to review it
  • Status: What stage the entry is in (Draft, Awaiting Review, Reviewed, etc.)
  • Date: When the entry was created

Entries are sorted newest first.

docs.title: Search for a Specific Member
docs.text:
1. Enter the member's name in the search box at the top of the page
  2. Click Search
  3. Result: Only entries for that member appear

docs.title: View All Members' Entries
docs.text:
1. Click All Users
  2. Result: All entries for all members in your group appear

docs.title: Assessment State Diagrams
docs.text: For detailed state flow diagrams showing how assessments and plans move through different states, see Assessments and Reviews - States & Flows section in the user documentation.

docs.title: Plan States
docs.text:
Plans have similar states:

  • Draft: Private, not yet sent for review
  • View Only: Shared for viewing; reviewer cannot make changes
  • Awaiting Review: Sent for feedback
  • Reviewed: Completed and visible to the subject

docs.title: Bulk Actions
docs.text: At the bottom of each table, you can select multiple entries and apply actions to them all at once.

docs.title: For Assessments
docs.text:
1. Check the boxes next to entries you want to action
  2. From the dropdown, select:
    • Decline: Move back to Draft (only works for Awaiting Review entries)
    • Delete: Remove the entry (type 1 entries go back to Awaiting Review; others are deleted)
  3. Click Apply Bulk Action
  4. Result: Message shows how many were updated and how many were skipped

docs.title: For Plans
docs.text:
1. Check the boxes next to plans you want to action
  2. From the dropdown, select:
    • Decline: Move back to Draft (only works for Awaiting Review entries)
    • Delete: Remove the plan
  3. Click Apply Bulk Action
  4. Result: Message shows how many were updated and how many were skipped

docs.title: Open and View an Assessment
docs.text:
1. Find the entry in the table
  2. Click the member name or click View
  3. The assessment opens showing:
    • Match or assignment details (teams, date, venue, grade)
    • Original observations and ratings from the person who created it
    • Reviewer feedback, ratings, and comments (if reviewed)
    • General reviewer comment
    • Any media attached (files, videos, documents)
    • User feedback (if submitted) — see below
  4. Click Close to go back to the table

docs.title: Viewing User Feedback on an Assessment
docs.text:
When a user submits feedback on a completed assessment (if this feature is enabled for your group), you can view it when you open the assessment:

  • Scroll to the User Feedback section near the bottom of the assessment
  • The feedback appears in a highlighted box
  • The submission date is shown
  • Feedback is read-only and cannot be edited or deleted

If no feedback appears: - The user has not submitted feedback yet - Assessment feedback may not be enabled for your group - The assessment is not in a completed state

docs.title: Using Autocomplete When Editing Teams or Venues
docs.text:
When viewing or editing an assessment that has team or venue fields, autocomplete suggestions appear automatically:

  • Start typing in a Team A, Team B, or Venue field
  • After 3 characters, matching suggestions appear
  • Click a suggestion to fill in the field automatically
  • This helps ensure consistent team and venue names across assessments

docs.title: Open and View a Plan
docs.text:
1. Find the plan in the table
  2. Click the member name or click View
  3. The plan opens showing:
    • Plan type and date
    • Member's original comments and entries
    • Reviewer feedback and responses (if reviewed)
    • General reviewer response
  4. Click Close to go back

docs.title: Reassign an Assessment to a Different Member
docs.text:
Note

Some assessment types cannot be reassigned. Only Match Day, Season, Media, and Custom reviews can be reassigned. Diary entries, Diary (Draft) entries, Peer reviews, and Plans cannot be reassigned.

Use this when an entry was created by the wrong person or needs to be moved.

  1. Find the entry in the table
  2. Click Reassign
  3. A popup appears with a dropdown list of members
  4. Select the new member
  5. Click Reassign entry
  6. Result: The entry now belongs to the selected member; they will see it in their list

Cannot be reassigned: - Diary entries - Diary (Draft) entries

docs.title: Change the Assigned Reviewer
docs.text:
Use this to assign a different person to review an entry that has already been reviewed.

  1. Find the entry in the table (must be in Reviewed status)
  2. Click Change Reviewer
  3. A popup appears with a dropdown list of reviewers
  4. Select the new reviewer
  5. Click Change reviewer
  6. Result: The new reviewer is now assigned; the old reviewer is removed

Who can do this:

  • Requires Reviewer or Owner role
  • Only available for entries in Reviewed status (not Draft or Awaiting Review)
  • Only available for certain assessment types (Match Day and others, not Diary entries)
  • If the member belongs to a subgroup, only reviewers in that same subgroup appear in the list
  • The new reviewer must have the Reviewer role in the group

docs.title: Decline a Review
docs.text:
Use this to return an entry that is awaiting review back to draft status.

  1. Find the entry (must be in Awaiting Review status)
  2. Click Decline
  3. Result: Entry goes back to Draft; reviewer is removed; it is marked as unviewed

docs.title: Delete an Assessment
docs.text:
Use this to remove an entry completely.

  1. Find the entry in the table
  2. Click Delete (from the row menu or bulk actions)
  3. Result:
    • Type 1 entries (Diary): Return to Awaiting Review status (soft delete)
    • Other types: Permanently deleted
  4. The entry no longer appears in your list

docs.title: Delete a Plan
docs.text:
Use this to remove a plan completely.

  1. Find the plan in the table
  2. Click Delete (from bulk actions)
  3. Result: Plan is permanently deleted; no longer appears in your list

docs.title: Understanding Media in Assessments
docs.text:
Assessments can include media attachments. When viewing an assessment, media appears in this order:

  • MOS upload: A folder or file you can download from the Match Official System
  • YouTube: An embedded video player (plays directly in the page)
  • Dropbox: A link that opens your Dropbox in a new window
  • OneDrive: A link that opens your OneDrive in a new window

Media is included by the person who created the assessment or the reviewer, depending on the assessment type.

docs.title: Special Workflows: Diary (Draft) Assessment
docs.text: Members can create a diary entry and request review. The review process allows reviewers to work in draft status:

docs.title: What Happens
docs.text:
1. User creates a diary entry and requests review
  2. Reviewer receives the request and opens the diary to review it
  3. Reviewer enters feedback and ratings, then saves as draft review
  4. Draft review is not yet sent to the user
  5. Reviewer can reopen and continue editing their draft review at any time
  6. When ready, reviewer submits the review (changes to final status)
  7. User sees the completed review

docs.title: Who Can Do This
docs.text:
• Users with the Reviewer role can review Diary (Draft) entries
  • While a reviewer is working on their review, the diary creator cannot edit the original entry
  • Draft reviews are visible only to the reviewer until submitted
  • Once submitted, the review becomes final and visible to the diary creator

docs.title: Key Points
docs.text:
• A diary can have only one review in progress
  • Draft reviews are temporary and do not count as completed until submitted
  • Reviewers can save their work as a draft without sending it to the member

docs.title: Access Control by Role
docs.text: Your ability to manage assessments depends on your role in the group. Each role has different visibility and capabilities on this page.

docs.title: Viewer Role
docs.text:
Viewer

Viewers can see all assessment types and create assessments on other users.

Can see:

  • All assessment types: diary, match day, season, media, custom, peer reviews

Can do:

  • View the list of all assessments and plans in the group
  • Search for entries by member name
  • Open and view assessment details, ratings, and comments
  • View reviewer feedback on completed assessments
  • View user feedback responses on assessments
  • Create assessments on other users (match day, media, season, custom) via the Create menu

Cannot do:

  • Reassign entries to different members
  • Change assigned reviewers
  • Decline review requests
  • Delete entries
  • Use bulk actions
  • Review diary entries (review capability requires Reviewer role)

docs.title: Reviewer Role
docs.text:
Reviewer

Reviewers can see diary entries and perform review-related actions.

Can see:

  • Diary entries only (not match day, season, media, custom, or peer reviews)

Can do:

  • View diary entries in the group
  • Search for entries by member name
  • Review diary entries that are awaiting review
  • Provide ratings, comments, and feedback on diary entries
  • Save draft reviews and submit completed reviews
  • Reassign entries to different members
  • Change the assigned reviewer on reviewed entries

Cannot do:

  • See non-diary assessment types (unless also has Viewer role)
  • Decline review requests
  • Delete entries
  • Use bulk actions

docs.title: Viewer + Reviewer Role
docs.text:
Viewer Reviewer

Users with both Viewer and Reviewer roles have combined capabilities.

Can see:

  • All assessment types: diary, match day, season, media, custom, peer reviews

Can do:

  • Everything Viewers can do (see all types)
  • Everything Reviewers can do (review, reassign, change reviewer)

docs.title: Owner Role
docs.text:
Owner

Owners have full administrative control over assessments and plans.

Can see:

  • All assessment types

Can do:

  • Everything Viewers and Reviewers can do
  • Decline review requests (returns entry to confidential/draft)
  • Delete entries (diary entries soft delete; other types permanently delete)
  • Use bulk actions to decline or delete multiple entries at once
  • Access all management functions

docs.title: Quick Reference Table
docs.text:
Capability Viewer Reviewer Viewer + Reviewer Owner See all assessment types Yes No Yes Yes See diary entries Yes Yes Yes Yes Create assessments on others Yes No Yes Yes Search members Yes Yes Yes Yes View feedback Yes Yes Yes Yes Review diary entries No Yes Yes Yes Reassign entries No Yes Yes Yes Change reviewer No Yes Yes Yes Decline review No No No Yes Delete entries No No No Yes Bulk actions No No No Yes

Bulk action buttons only appear if you have Owner access.

docs.title: Tracking Who Has Viewed Assessments
docs.text:
The system tracks whether a member has viewed a reviewed assessment. When they view it and click Mark as read, it's marked as Seen. This helps you know who has viewed their assessment.

For View Only assessments, the system automatically marks them as Seen when an admin opens them to review.

docs.title: Can't Find an Entry
docs.text:
• Check you are on the correct view (Assessments vs Plans)
  • Try searching by member name
  • Click All Users to see every entry in your group
  • Check the user's subgroup - you can only see entries if you have admin access to that subgroup

docs.title: Search Returns No Results
docs.text:
• Check the spelling of the member's name
  • The search looks in member name and reviewer name
  • If searching by name, ensure at least part of the name is spelled correctly
  • Try a broader search (first name only, or last name only)

docs.title: Can't Change Reviewer or Reassign
docs.text:
• Ensure you have Owner access to the group
  • Check that the dropdown list isn't empty - you must have at least one reviewer available
  • For reassign: you can only reassign to users in your group
  • For change reviewer: the new reviewer must have the Reviewer role

docs.title: Entry Still Shows Old Reviewer After Change
docs.text:
• Refresh the page (press F5 or Ctrl+R)
  • The change takes effect immediately in the database, but the page cache may show the old value until refreshed

docs.title: Bulk Actions Show "Skipped"
docs.text:
• Entries may be skipped if they are in a state that doesn't allow the action
  • Decline only works on Awaiting Review entries
  • Delete works on all entries (some soft delete, some hard delete)
  • Check the status column to see which entries can be actioned

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Use search before applying bulk actions to focus on the right entries
  • Check entry status before trying to decline (only works for Awaiting Review)
  • When reassigning, ensure the new user is in the correct subgroup
  • If changing reviewers frequently, consider using the All Users view to see the full picture
  • Reviewer assignments persist until you change them again

docs.text:

  • Admin Group Settings

docs.title: Data Management: Clean and Normalise Field Values
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner access required

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Data Management helps you clean and standardise data entries in your group. You can identify variations of the same team name or venue and merge them into a single canonical value.

This ensures consistent data across assessments and makes reporting more accurate.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text:
1. From the main menu, click Admin
  2. Click Data Management

docs.title: What This Page Does
docs.text:
Data Management shows you all unique values entered for teams and venues across all assessments in your group. You can search, select similar values, and merge them into one standardised entry.

When you merge values, all existing assessments that used the old values will be updated to use the new canonical value.

docs.title: Field Type Selection
docs.text:
Two buttons let you choose which type of data to manage:

  • Teams - Shows all team names from Team A and Team B fields
  • Venue - Shows all venue names entered across assessments

Click a button to view and manage that field type.

docs.title: Filter and Target Value
docs.text:
Filter Type keywords to narrow down the list of values shown in the table below.

Target Value Enter the canonical name you want to use after merging. All selected values will be changed to this name.

docs.title: Data Table
docs.text:
The table shows:

  • Select checkbox - Check boxes to select values for merging
  • Value - The current name as it appears in assessments
  • Count - How many assessments use this value

Values are listed alphabetically.

docs.title: How to Merge Values
docs.text: Merging combines multiple variations into one standardised name.

docs.title: Example Use Case
docs.text:
Your assessments might have:

  • "Melbourne Tigers"
  • "Melbourne tigers"
  • "Tigers"
  • "Melb Tigers"

You can merge all of these into "Melbourne Tigers".

docs.title: Steps to Merge
docs.text:
1. Click Teams or Venue to select the field type
  2. Optional: Use the filter to search for similar values
  3. Check the boxes next to all values you want to merge
  4. Enter the canonical name in the Target Value field
  5. Click Merge Selected
  6. Review the confirmation modal showing:
    • All values being changed
    • The target value they will become
  7. Click Yes, Merge Values to confirm

Result: All selected values are replaced with the target value across all assessments.

docs.title: Merge Confirmation Modal
docs.text:
Before merging, a modal appears showing:

Source Values All values you selected for merging

Target Value The canonical name all values will become

Warning Message A reminder that this action is irreversible

You must confirm the merge by clicking Yes, Merge Values.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
Check Before Merging Always review the list of source values and target value carefully before confirming.

Start Small Try merging a few similar values first before tackling larger cleanups.

Use Consistent Naming Establish naming conventions for teams and venues to reduce future variations.

Refresh After Changes Click the Refresh button after merging to see the updated data table.

docs.title: Field Requirements
docs.text:
Target Value, required You must enter a target value before the Merge Selected button becomes active.

At Least Two Values Selected You must select at least two values to merge.

docs.title: Clean Up Team Name Variations
docs.text:
1. Click Teams
  2. Use the filter to search for a team name
  3. Select all variations of the same team
  4. Enter the correct team name in Target Value
  5. Click Merge Selected
  6. Confirm the merge

docs.title: Standardise Venue Names
docs.text:
1. Click Venue
  2. Scroll through the list or use the filter
  3. Select duplicate or similar venue names
  4. Enter the standardised venue name in Target Value
  5. Click Merge Selected
  6. Confirm the merge

docs.title: Search for Specific Values
docs.text:
1. Select the field type
  2. Type keywords in the Filter field
  3. The table updates to show matching values only
  4. Click the X button to clear the filter

docs.title: Merge Selected Button is Disabled
docs.text:
Symptoms The button appears greyed out and cannot be clicked

Solution

  1. Ensure you have selected at least two checkboxes in the table
  2. Ensure you have entered a value in the Target Value field
  3. Both conditions must be met to activate the button

docs.title: Changes Not Appearing
docs.text:
Symptoms After merging, the old values still appear in the table

Solution

  1. Click the Refresh button to reload the data
  2. The merged values should now show the updated canonical name

docs.title: No Values Appear in the Table
docs.text:
Symptoms The table is empty after selecting a field type

Common Causes

  • No assessments exist in your group yet
  • All existing assessments have empty values for this field
  • Data is still loading

Solution

  1. Wait a moment for data to load
  2. Click Refresh to reload the data
  3. If still empty, create some assessments with team or venue data first

docs.title: Important Warnings
docs.text:
Irreversible Action

Merging values is permanent and cannot be undone. All assessments using the old values will be updated immediately. Always double-check before confirming a merge.

Group Wide Impact

Changes affect all assessments in your group, including historical records. Consider the impact on existing reports and statistics.

docs.title: Admin: Exam Management
docs.text:
Access Level

Trainer or Owner access required

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Build and administer exams using reusable question banks. Assign to users or subgroups with time windows and completion requirements. Analyse results and export for records.

docs.title: Create an Exam
docs.text:
1. Click Create New Exam.
  2. Enter title, description/instructions.
  3. Add questions (from bank or new) and set order.
  4. Save as Draft.

docs.title: Question Types
docs.text:
The system supports three question types:

  • Single: Multiple choice with one correct answer.
  • Multiple: Multiple select where users select all correct options.
  • True/False: Binary true or false question.

docs.title: Creating Questions
docs.text:
Add questions to build your exam:

  1. Open the exam and click Add Question.
  2. Choose a question type: Single, Multiple, or True/False.
  3. Enter the question text.
  4. Add answer options and mark the correct answer(s).
  5. Click Save Question.

Tips:

  • Use clear wording and avoid ambiguity.
  • Mix difficulty levels and question types.
  • For Multiple type questions, select all correct answers.

docs.title: Scoring and Settings
docs.text: When creating or editing an exam, you configure these settings:

docs.title: Exam Details
docs.text:
Exam Name, required - A short name to identify the exam - Displayed to users before they begin

Questions to Present, required - How many questions to randomly select from the total pool - Set to 0 to include all questions - Helps create randomised tests from a larger question bank

docs.title: Timing
docs.text:
Time Limit - Time in minutes to complete the exam - Set to 0 for no time limit - Users see a countdown timer during the exam - When time expires, the exam automatically submits

Start Date - The date the exam opens for users - Users cannot sit the exam before this date - Leave empty to open immediately

End Date - The date the exam closes - Users cannot sit the exam after this date - Affects "Completion required" enforcement

docs.title: Scoring
docs.text: Pass Mark %, required - Minimum score percentage required to pass (1-100) - Displayed to users before they begin the exam - Used to determine pass/fail badge on results

docs.title: Completion
docs.text:
Completion Required - When enabled, users must sit this exam before the end date - Blocks other workflows until completed (use sparingly) - Creates a "must complete" flag visible to users

Allow Resits - When enabled, users can retake the exam after a failed attempt - When disabled, users may only sit the exam once

Notify on Completion - When enabled, group administrators receive an email when someone completes the exam - Useful for tracking high-stakes or mandatory exams

docs.title: Descriptions
docs.text:
Exam Description - Text shown to users before they begin the exam - Use for instructions, tips, or context - Appears in the "Ready to start?" modal

Exam End Description - Text shown to users after they submit the exam - Use for encouragement, next steps, or feedback instructions - Appears in the completion modal

docs.title: Publish and Assign
docs.text:
1. Set exam to Published when ready.
  2. Assign to individual users, subgroups, or entire group.
  3. Configure availability window and reminders.
  4. Notify assignees by email (if enabled).

docs.title: Monitor and Results
docs.text:
• Attempts: Started vs. completed counts.
  • Scores: Individual and average scores; pass/fail.
  • Question analysis: Difficulty index, most missed items (where available).
  • Export: Download results to CSV for archiving/audits.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Users can’t see exam: Check publish state, assignment scope, and date window.
  • Results missing: Ensure attempts were submitted; check filters.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Pilot exams with a small group first.
  • ✅ Mix question types to test understanding, not memorisation.
  • ✅ Keep instructions clear and include expected duration.

docs.title: Getting Started: New Organisations
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner access required

Welcome to the Match Official System. This guide walks you through the essential setup steps to get your organisation operational.

docs.title: What You Need to Do First
docs.text: When you first log in as an administrator, you need to configure your group's settings and assessment templates. This typically takes 30-45 minutes and only needs to be done once or as you change your templates to enrich data over site.

docs.title: Step 1: Access Group Settings
docs.text:
1. From the main menu, click Admin
  2. Click Group Settings
  3. You see the Group Settings page with several tabs on the left sidebar

The first section shows your License Information - this tells you how many users and subgroups your organisation is entitled to.

docs.title: Step 2: Set Up Your Organisation Details
Configure Calendar Start
docs.text:
1. Click the Calendar Start tab
  2. Select the month when your calendar year begins (e.g., July for a football season starting in July)
  3. This month becomes the first month throughout the system

docs.title: Configure Location
docs.text:
1. Click the Location tab
  2. Enter your group's primary location or city
  3. Enter your postcode
  4. Click Save location

Your location is used for weather information and location-based features.

docs.title: Step 3: Configure User Access
docs.text: These settings determine which folders and features are available to users.

docs.title: Enable Folder Access
docs.text:
1. Click the Folder Settings tab
  2. Select Yes for:
    • User folder - Allows each user to have a personal file storage area
    • Subgroups folder - Allows subgroups to have shared file storage areas
  3. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Configure User Response Options
docs.text:
1. Click the User responses tab
  2. Decide which features users can access:
    • Confidential entries (private entries not visible to others)
    • View only entries (shareable but not editable by others)
    • Review requests (ability to request feedback)
  3. Check both Diary and Plan sections
  4. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Set Up Notifications
docs.text:
1. Click the Notifications tab
  2. For each notification type (Diary, Assessment, Plan, Peer), select Yes or No to enable email alerts
  3. Start with Yes for most notifications to keep users informed
  4. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Step 4: Create Subgroups (Optional)
docs.text:
If your organisation has teams, departments, or divisions, create subgroups.

  1. Click the Subgroups tab
  2. For each subgroup, enter the name and click Add subgroup
  3. Common subgroups:
    • Team 1, Team 2, Team 3 (for sports organisations)
    • Department A, Department B (for administrative divisions)
    • Region North, Region South (for geographic divisions)

Each subgroup gets its own folder and can have its own members.

docs.title: Step 5: Add Quick Links (Optional)
docs.text:
Quick links appear on the home page and help users access important resources.

  1. Click the Quick Links tab
  2. Add links for:
    • Your organisation's website
    • Training resources
    • Policies and procedures
    • Contact information
  3. Select an icon for each link
  4. Click Add quick link

docs.title: Step 6: Set Up User Registration (Optional)
docs.text:
If you want new users to register themselves instead of creating accounts manually:

  1. Click the User registration tab
  2. Select Yes
  3. Share the provided registration URL with potential users
  4. New users who register will need to be assigned to subgroups by an administrator

docs.title: Step 7: Configure Assessment Templates
docs.text:
Now that the basic group settings are complete, configure how assessments will work.

Important: Plan Your Templates Carefully

Before you start, plan your templates carefully. Each time you modify a template, the previous version is archived to preserve historical data. Frequent changes can create data inconsistency. Design once, then only modify if absolutely necessary.

  1. From the Admin menu, click Group Settings again
  2. Click the Assessment templates tab
  3. You see two main sections: Assessments and Plans

docs.title: Diary Template
docs.text:
Your users will likely create diary entries most frequently. Configure this first:

  1. Click Diary in the Assessments section
  2. Set Number of days to 3 (most commonly used)
  3. Enable Allow users to request review? - Set to Yes
  4. Enable User can see ratings section? - Set to Yes
  5. Enable User can see comments section? - Set to Yes
  6. For admin visibility, select:
    • Admin ratings: Yes, response shared with user
    • Admin comments: Yes, response shared with user
  7. Enter a User Description explaining how to complete diary entries
  8. Enter an Admin Description with guidance for reviewing
  9. For the 6 detail fields, enter custom fields relevant to your organisation:
    • Detail 1: "Key decisions"
    • Detail 2: "Performance observations"
    • Detail 3: "Areas for improvement"
    • Leave Details 4-6 blank if you don't need them
  10. Remember: Diary entries always include three hardcoded fields: Team A, Team B, and Venue
  11. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Match Day Template
docs.text:
Configure assessments for specific match/event days:

  1. Click Match Day
  2. Set Number of days to 1
  3. Select Show ratings section? - Choose appropriate visibility
  4. Select Show comments section? - Choose appropriate visibility
  5. Add 6 custom detail fields:
    • Detail 1: "In-game decisions"
    • Detail 2: "Communication"
    • Detail 3: "Positioning"
    • Detail 4: "Positioning"
    • Detail 5: "Player management"
    • Detail 6: "Overall performance"
  6. Remember: Match day entries always include: Team A, Team B, and Venue
  7. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Other Assessment Types
docs.text:
Configure the remaining types based on your needs:

  • Season: For longer-term reviews (usually just detail fields, no ratings/comments)
  • Media: For video/image assessments
  • Custom: For organisation-specific assessments
  • Peer: For peer-to-peer reviews between officials

For each: 1. Click the type name 2. Add detail fields relevant to your organisation 3. Configure ratings and comments visibility 4. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: Step 8: Set Up Rating Scales
docs.text:
1. Still in Assessment Templates, click the Ratings tab
  2. Add rating options users will see. For example:
    • "Excellent - Far exceeds expectations"
    • "Good - Meets expectations"
    • "Needs improvement - Below expectations"
    • "Not assessed"
  3. For each, click Add rating

These ratings appear in all assessment forms.

docs.title: Step 9: Create Competitions (Optional)
docs.text:
If you want to track specific competitions or events:

  1. Click the Competitions tab
  2. Enter competition or event names
  3. Click Add competition

Examples: - "Premier League" - "Cup Competition" - "Tournament" - "Friendly"

docs.title: Step 10: Customise Ratings and Comments (Advanced)
docs.text:
For more advanced configuration, you can customise rating and comment fields per assessment type:

  1. Go to each assessment type (Diary, Match Day, etc.)
  2. Scroll to see rating options (Rating 1 through Rating 20)
  3. Enter custom rating labels specific to your organisation
  4. Below that, enter comment field labels (Comment 1 through Comment 10)
  5. Click Save assessment design

docs.title: For a Football Association
docs.text:
Group Settings

  • Calendar Start: January
  • Location: headquarters city
  • User folder: Yes
  • Subgroups folder: Yes
  • Create subgroups: Referees, Assistants, Video Assistants
  • Notifications: enable Match/Assessment and Review alerts as needed

Assessment Templates

  • Diary: Number of days = 1; full ratings and comments enabled; allow review requests
  • Match Day: Number of days = 1;
  • Peer: Number of days = 1; peer ratings enabled (confidential option available)
  • Media: enable for video/image attachments where required

Detail fields (examples)

  • Decision making
  • Positioning
  • Communication
  • Game awareness

Ratings

  • Excellent — Exceeds expectations
  • Good — Meets expectations
  • Satisfactory — Meets basic expectations
  • Needs improvement — Below expectations

Suggested defaults

  1. Diary: 1 day; allow review requests; user and admin ratings + comments visible
  2. Match Day: 1 day; include hardcoded fields; media uploads optional
  3. Peer: peer ratings enabled; confidentiality option on request

docs.title: For a Cricket Association
docs.text:
Group Settings

  • Calendar Start: April
  • Location: county or club headquarters
  • User folder: Yes
  • Subgroups folder: Yes
  • Create subgroups: Umpires, Scorers, Coaches, Squad panels
  • Notifications: enable Match/Assessment and Review alerts

Assessment Templates

  • Diary: Number of days = 2; ratings and comments enabled
  • Match Day: Number of days = 1;
  • Peer: Number of days = 2; peer feedback enabled
  • Media: for video/image reviews and timestamped comments
  • Season: end‑of‑season summary reviews
  • Custom: fitness and technical skills assessments

Detail fields (examples)

  • Decision making
  • Positioning & movement
  • Communication
  • Playing conditions
  • Match management
  • Teamwork
  • Use of technology (e.g., DRS/video)

Ratings

  • Excellent — Far exceeds expectations
  • Good — Meets expectations
  • Satisfactory — Acceptable standard
  • Needs improvement — Below expectations
  • Not assessed

Suggested defaults

  1. Diary: 1 day; allow review requests; user/admin ratings and comments visible
  2. Match Day: 1 day; include the three hardcoded fields; enable media uploads and time‑coded comments
  3. Peer: peer ratings enabled with confidential option
  4. Media: allow reviewers to timestamp clips and leave time‑coded comments

docs.title: For a Sports Development Programme
docs.text:
Group Settings

  • Calendar Start: September
  • Location: facility location
  • User folder: Yes
  • Subgroups folder: Yes
  • Create subgroups: Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced
  • Notifications: enable training and progress alerts

Assessment Templates

  • Diary: Number of days = 2; comments only for reflective learning
  • Custom: development progress tracking
  • Season: end‑of‑season reviews

Detail fields (examples)

  • Technical skills
  • Fitness level
  • Tactical understanding
  • Teamwork
  • Development goals

Suggested defaults

  1. Diary: 2 days; comments only for reflection and coaching notes
  2. Custom: track progression against learning outcomes
  3. Season: summary focus with fewer ratings

docs.title: For a High Performance Programme
docs.text:
Group Settings

  • Calendar Start: January
  • Location: performance centre or headquarters
  • User folder: Yes
  • Subgroups folder: Yes
  • Create subgroups: Department A, Department B (or by sport/discipline)
  • Notifications: all enabled (daily/weekly summaries)

Assessment Templates

  • Diary: Number of days = 1; comments only for rapid feedback
  • Season: quarterly reviews (summary and trends)
  • Custom: training module and competency assessments
  • Media: support for technical video review

Detail fields (examples)

  • Learning outcomes
  • Competency demonstrated
  • Areas for development
  • Next steps
  • Fitness and recovery metrics

Suggested defaults

  1. Diary: 1 day; comments only to capture immediate coaching notes
  2. Season: quarterly cadence with trend reporting
  3. Custom: align templates to training modules and competency frameworks

These examples are practical starting points — tailor fields, visibility and notification settings to match your organisation's workflows and governance.

docs.title: What to Do After Setup
docs.text:
Once you've completed these setup steps:

  1. Add users to your group (see User Management)
  2. Assign users to subgroups if you created them
  3. Share the registration link with potential users (if registration is enabled)
  4. Test a sample entry by creating a diary or assessment yourself
  5. Communicate settings to users so they know what to expect

docs.title: How long does setup take?
docs.text: Most organisations complete setup in 30-45 minutes on the first attempt. You can always adjust settings later.

docs.title: Can I change settings after setup?
docs.text: Yes. All settings can be modified at any time. Changes to templates only apply to new assessments created after the change.

docs.title: Do existing entries change if I modify a template?
docs.text: No. Existing assessments keep their original format. Only new assessments use the updated template.

docs.title: What should I do if I'm not sure about a setting?
docs.text: Start with the recommended defaults and adjust later based on user feedback. Settings can be changed anytime without affecting existing data.

docs.title: Who can see the entries users create?
docs.text: That depends on your response settings. By default: - Users can make entries confidential (private) - Admins can see all entries - Reviewers can only see entries assigned to them - Users can request reviews
