docs.title: Group Settings
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner access required

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Group Settings allows administrators to manage how your organisation operates within the Match Official System. You can control user registration, calendar dates, folder access, notification settings, and how users interact with assessments and plans.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text: From the main menu, click Admin then Group Settings.

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
• You must be an administrator with the correct access level
  • Changes to group settings affect all users in your group
  • Some settings are destructive (such as folder deletion) and cannot be easily undone
  • Your group's licence information is displayed at the top of the page

docs.title: Subgroups
docs.text:
Subgroups allow you to organise users within your group. Users can be assigned to one or more subgroups for filtering, reporting, and targeted communications.

View and manage existing subgroups:

  1. Navigate to Group Settings
  2. Click the Subgroups tab
  3. You see a list of all subgroups in your group
  4. For each subgroup, you can:
    • Click Edit to rename it
    • Click Delete to remove it (the subgroup folder will be deleted)
    • Click Recreate Folder to restore a missing folder (if folder viewing is enabled)

Add a new subgroup:

  1. In the Subgroups section, enter the subgroup name in the text field
  2. Click Add subgroup
  3. A new subgroup is created with its own folder
  4. You can now add users to this subgroup

Note

The number of subgroups you can create depends on your licence.

docs.title: Theme
docs.text:
Select a colour theme for your group. This affects the appearance of the system for all users in your group, unless they choose their own theme in their profile settings.

Change the group theme:

  1. In the Major Settings section, click the Theme tab
  2. Click on a theme image to select it
  3. The system reloads and applies your new theme immediately
  4. All users in your group see the new theme

Requesting a new theme is possible by contacting Cortana Design.

docs.title: User Registration
docs.text:
Control whether new users can self-register for your group. When enabled, users can request access via a registration link.

Enable or disable user registration:

  1. Click the User registration tab
  2. Select Yes to allow registration or No to disable it
  3. If enabled, you see a registration URL that you can share with potential users
  4. New users who register will have group-level access (administrators must assign them to subgroups afterwards)

docs.title: Calendar Start
docs.text:
Set when your group's calendar year begins. This affects seasonal reporting and date filtering throughout the system.

Change the calendar start month:

  1. Click the Calendar Start tab
  2. Select your preferred starting month from the dropdown
  3. The selected month is now the first month of your calendar year throughout the system

docs.title: Location
docs.text:
Set your group's default location for weather information and other location-based features.

Save location details:

  1. Click the Location tab
  2. Enter your group's location (town/city)
  3. Enter your postcode
  4. Click Save location
  5. Result: These details are stored and used for location-based features

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
Manage the shortcut links displayed on the home page for your group. These provide quick access to frequently used external resources.

View quick links:

  1. Click the Quick Links tab
  2. You see a table of all links currently displayed

Add a new quick link:

  1. In the Quick Links section, enter:
    • Link title: The text users see
    • Link url: The full web address (e.g., https://example.com)
    • Icon: Select an icon from the dropdown (optional)
  2. Click Add quick link
  3. The link is added to the home page immediately

Edit a quick link:

  1. Click Edit next to the link
  2. Update the title, URL, or icon
  3. Click Update

Delete a quick link:

  1. Click Delete next to the link
  2. The link is removed from the home page

docs.title: User Access and Actions
docs.text: These settings control what features users can access and what actions they can perform.

docs.title: Folder Settings
docs.text:
Control which file storage folders are available for your group. Disabling a folder will permanently delete all files within it.

Enable or disable folders:

  1. Click the Folder Settings tab
  2. For User folder: Select Yes to enable or No to disable
  3. For Subgroups folder: Select Yes to enable or No to disable
  4. Click Save user settings at the bottom of the page

Warning

Setting a folder to 'No' will delete the folder and all its contents. This is a destructive operation and data cannot be recovered.

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
Enable or disable specific features for users in your group.

Enable or disable peer assessments:

  1. Click the Modules tab
  2. Select Yes to allow peer assessments or No to disable them
  3. Click Save user settings

Enable or disable user search:

  1. In the Modules section, select Yes to allow users to search profile information or No to disable it
  2. Click Save user settings

docs.title: User Responses
docs.text:
Set how users can submit diary and plan entries, including confidentiality and review options.

Diary entries - Allow users to:

  1. Click the User responses tab
  2. Make entries confidential: Select Yes or No
  3. Make entries view only: Select Yes or No
  4. Request a review: Select Yes or No

Plan entries - Allow users to:

  1. Make entries confidential: Select Yes or No
  2. Make entries view only: Select Yes or No
  3. Request a review: Select Yes or No

Assessment feedback - Allow users to:

  1. Submit feedback on assessments: Select Yes or No
    • When enabled, users can provide a one-time feedback response after viewing an assessment
  2. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Configure automatic email notifications for various activities.

Diary notification settings:

  1. Click the Notifications tab
  2. Under "Notifications for diary entries", choose Yes or No for:
    • Notify reviewers of new review requests
    • Notify user when reviewed
    • Notify reviewer when unread entry is seen by user
  3. Click Save user settings

Assessment notification settings:

  1. Under "Notifications for assessment entries", choose Yes or No for:
    • Notify user when new assessment is assigned
    • Notify reviewer when assessment is seen by user
    • Notify reviewer when user submits feedback on an assessment
  2. Click Save user settings

Plan notification settings:

  1. Under "Notifications for plan entries", choose Yes or No for:
    • Notify reviewers of new review requests
    • Notify user when reviewed
    • Notify reviewer when entry isings**

Peer review notification settings:

  1. Under "Notifications for peer review entries", choose Yes or No for:
    • Notify user of review
    • Notify admin(s) of review
    • Notify reviewee when review seen
    • Notify admin(s) when review seen
  2. Click Save user settings

docs.title: Create a new subgroup
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Group Settings
  2. In the Subgroups section, enter a name for your new subgroup
  3. Click Add subgroup
  4. The subgroup is created with its own folder
  5. Add users to the subgroup through the Membership section

docs.title: Change your group's theme
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the Theme tab
  3. Click on the theme image you want to use
  4. The page reloads with the new theme applied

docs.title: Enable user registration for your group
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the User registration tab
  3. Select Yes
  4. Share the registration URL with potential users
  5. New users can register themselves

docs.title: Set when your calendar year starts
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the Calendar Start tab
  3. Select the month your calendar year begins
  4. All dates throughout the system reflect this starting month

docs.title: Add multiple quick links
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the Quick Links tab
  3. Add the first link: enter title, URL, and icon, then click Add quick link
  4. Add the second link: repeat the process
  5. Continue for each link
  6. All links appear on the home page in order

docs.title: Restrict folder access
docs.text:
1. Go to Group Settings
  2. Click the Folder Settings tab
  3. Select No for User folder or Subgroups folder (or both)
  4. Click Save user settings
  5. Users no longer see or access that folder

Warning

Folders will be deleted along with all their contents.

docs.title: Settings not saving
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You click Save but the settings don't change
  • Error message appears

How to fix

  1. Check that you have administrator access
  2. Verify all required fields are completed
  3. Try saving again
  4. If the problem continues, contact your system administrator

Common causes

  • Insufficient access permissions
  • Missing or invalid information in fields
  • Browser cache issues

docs.title: Quick links not appearing on home page
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • You added a quick link but don't see it
  • Links appear for some users but not others

How to fix

  1. Go back to Group Settings
  2. Click the Quick Links tab
  3. Verify the link was created (it should appear in the table)
  4. Check that the URL is valid and starts with http:// or https://
  5. Clear your browser cache and refresh the page

Common causes

  • URL format is incorrect
  • Browser cache preventing display of new link
  • User permissions preventing access

docs.title: Folder is missing
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • A subgroup folder is marked as missing
  • Users cannot access the folder

How to fix

  1. Go to Group Settings
  2. In the Subgroups section, click Recreate Folder next to the missing subgroup
  3. The folder is recreated
  4. Users can now access it again

Note: Folder recreation is only available if folder viewing is enabled in Folder Settings.

docs.title: Related Pages
docs.text:
• Assessment Templates - Configure assessment types and templates
  • User Management - Add and manage users
  • Membership and Roles - Assign users to groups and subgroups

docs.title: Admin: Membership and Roles
docs.text:
Owner access required

Only users with Owner access can manage membership and roles.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Membership and Roles page lets you manage who belongs to your group and what they can do. You can assign access levels, grant specific roles, and organise users into subgroups.

How to access: From the main menu, select Admin then Membership and Roles.

docs.title: Understanding Access Levels and Roles
docs.text:
The system uses two components to control permissions:

Access Level (choose one):

  • User: Standard member with personal workspace access
  • Owner: Full administrative control of the group

Roles (choose any combination):

  • Viewer: Can create assessments on other users
  • Reviewer: Can review diary and plan entries, and run reports
  • Trainer: Can manage exams (group-level only)
  • Communications: Can manage news articles (group-level only)
  • Files Manager: Can upload, delete, and organise files and folders

A member can have multiple roles. For example, a coach might have both Viewer and Reviewer roles.

For detailed information about what each role can do, see Levels of Access.

docs.title: Search by name
docs.text:
1. Type a name in the search box
  2. Click Search or press Enter
  3. Matching members appear in the list

docs.title: Filter by role
docs.text:
1. Click the Filter dropdown
  2. Select one or more access levels or roles to filter by
  3. Click Apply
  4. Only members with the selected roles appear

To clear filters, click Clear in the filter dropdown.

docs.title: Adding a Member
docs.text:
Add existing system users to your group.

  1. Click Add Member (appears when viewing a subgroup or group)
  2. Search for the user by name
  3. Click on the user to select them
  4. Choose an Access Level: - User: Standard member - Owner (Admin): Full administrative access
  5. Select any Roles to assign: - Tick the checkboxes for roles this person needs - You can select multiple roles
  6. Click Add Member

The member now appears in your group with the assigned access level and roles.

Tip

Start with the minimum roles needed. You can add more later if required.

docs.title: Editing a Member
docs.text:
Change a member's access level or roles.

  1. Find the member in the list
  2. Click the Edit button (pencil icon)
  3. Change the Access Level if needed
  4. Tick or untick Roles as required
  5. Click Save

Changes take effect immediately.

docs.title: What happens when you change roles
docs.text:
• Adding a role: The member gains access to that feature immediately
  • Removing a role: The member loses access to that feature immediately
  • Changing to Owner: The member gains full administrative access
  • Changing from Owner to User: The member loses administrative access but keeps any assigned roles

docs.title: Removing a Member
docs.text:
Remove a member from your group.

  1. Find the member in the list
  2. Click the Remove button
  3. Confirm the removal

Removing a member:

  • Removes them from the group only
  • Does not delete their account from the system
  • Does not affect their membership in other groups
  • Can be reversed by adding them again

docs.title: Working with Subgroups
docs.text: Subgroups help organise members into teams, regions, or divisions.

docs.title: Viewing subgroup members
docs.text:
• Click on a subgroup name to expand it
  • Use Expand All to see all subgroups at once
  • Use Collapse All to close all subgroups

docs.title: Adding members to a subgroup
docs.text:
1. Expand the subgroup
  2. Click Add Member within that subgroup
  3. Follow the standard add member process

Members can belong to multiple subgroups.

docs.title: Subgroup-level roles
docs.text:
Some roles work differently at the subgroup level:

  • Viewer and Reviewer can be assigned at subgroup level
  • Files Manager can be assigned at subgroup level
  • Trainer and Communications are group-level only (not available for subgroups)

For more details about subgroup permissions, see Subgroup Membership.

docs.title: Role Badges
docs.text:
Members display coloured badges showing their roles:

Badge Role Owner Owner Viewer Viewer Reviewer Reviewer Trainer Trainer Communications Communications Files Manager Files Manager

A member may display multiple badges if they have multiple roles.

docs.title: User not found when adding
docs.text: The person may not have an account in the system yet. They need to register first, or you can create an account for them in User Management.

docs.title: Cannot assign certain roles
docs.text: Some roles (Trainer, Communications) are only available at the group level, not subgroup level. If you are editing a subgroup membership, these options will not appear.

docs.title: Member cannot access expected features
docs.text:
Check that:

  1. They have the correct role assigned
  2. They are in the correct subgroup (if features are subgroup-specific)
  3. They have logged out and back in (some permission changes require a fresh login)

docs.title: Duplicate member entries
docs.text: If someone appears twice, remove the duplicate entry and keep a single membership record with the correct roles.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Apply the principle of least privilege - give only the roles needed
  • Review role assignments regularly, especially for Reviewer and Owner
  • Use subgroups to organise members and control visibility
  • Document role assignments for compliance if required

docs.title: Related Pages
docs.text:
• Levels of Access: Detailed explanation of each role
  • User Management: Creating and managing user accounts
  • Subgroup Membership: How subgroups affect permissions
  • Group Settings: Configure group options

docs.title: News Management
docs.text:
Access Level

Communications or Owner access required

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Create and manage news articles for your association. You can publish articles to all members or target specific subgroups, optionally send email notifications, and attach files. If enabled, you can also create articles by sending emails to a designated mailbox.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text:
1. Click Admin
  2. Select News Management
  3. Result: The News Management page opens showing all existing articles

docs.title: How to Create an Article
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Admin then News Management
  2. Click New News
  3. Enter a Title for the article
  4. Select your Audience:
    • Select All Users to reach all members in your association
    • Select a subgroup name to reach only members of that group
  5. Choose if you want to send a notification email:
    • Select Yes to email all members in the audience
    • Select No to skip email notification
  6. Insert an image (optional):
    • Click the upload area under Insert Image
    • Select and upload an image file
  7. Enter your article content in the Content field
  8. Add attachments (optional):
    • Click the upload area under Add Attachments
    • Select one or more files to attach
  9. Click Save
  10. Result: The article is created and immediately visible to the audience you selected. If you selected Yes for notifications, members will receive an email with the article title and content.

Fields:

  • Title (required): The article headline
  • Audience (required): Who receives this article. Choose All Users for everyone or select a specific subgroup
  • Send notification (required): Whether to email the article to your audience
  • Insert Image (optional): Add a visual to the article
  • Content (required): The full article text
  • Add Attachments (optional): Include documents, PDFs, or other files

Tips:

  • Keep titles clear and descriptive
  • Target specific subgroups when the news only affects certain members
  • Use attachments to share supporting documents
  • Send email notifications for important announcements

docs.title: How to Edit an Article
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Admin then News Management
  2. Find the article you want to edit
  3. Click Edit
  4. Update the title, audience, content, or attachments
  5. Click Save
  6. Result: The article is updated immediately

Note

When editing, if you upload new attachments, they replace any existing attachments

docs.title: How to Delete an Article
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Admin then News Management
  2. Find the article you want to delete
  3. Click Delete
  4. Confirm the deletion when prompted
  5. Result: The article is permanently removed from the news feed

docs.title: Email-to-News (Optional Feature)
docs.text: Your group may have Email-to-News enabled, which allows you to create news articles by sending an email to a designated mailbox.

docs.title: How to Use Email-to-News
docs.text:
1. On the News Management page, find the Email-to-News section (if enabled for your group)
  2. Note the mailbox address provided (e.g., mos-news@matchofficialsystem.com)
  3. Send an email to that address with:
    • Subject: The article title
    • Body: The article content
    • Attachments: Any files to include with the article
  4. Result: The article is automatically created and sent to all members in your group

Tips:

  • Keep subjects concise and descriptive
  • Format your email body clearly (line breaks will be preserved)
  • Attachments should be reasonable file sizes
  • Articles created via email follow the same targeting as manual articles (applies to entire group)

Note

The sender's email address must match someone with Communications or Owner role in the group. If the email doesn't match, the message will be rejected.

docs.title: No articles appear on the News page
docs.text:
Symptoms: The News page shows no articles

How to Fix:

  1. Check that you are logged in to your account
  2. Verify you have membership in at least one group or association
  3. Check with your administrator to confirm articles have been published
  4. Try refreshing the page

Common Causes:

  • No articles have been published for your association or subgroups
  • Your membership may not include access to published news

docs.title: Articles I created don't appear
docs.text:
Symptoms: News article created but not visible to members

How to Fix:

  1. Verify the audience is set correctly:
    • Check if you selected All Users or a subgroup
    • Only members of the selected audience can see the article
  2. Check that the article was saved successfully (look for confirmation message)
  3. Try refreshing the news page
  4. Verify members are actually part of the audience group

Common Causes:

  • Article is targeted to wrong audience
  • Members are not subscribed to the audience subgroup
  • Article was not saved successfully

docs.title: Attachments don't download
docs.text:
Symptoms: Clicking an attachment doesn't open or download the file

How to Fix:

  1. Refresh the page and try again
  2. Check your internet connection
  3. Verify you are logged in
  4. Try a different file if multiple attachments exist
  5. Contact your administrator if the problem continues

Common Causes:

  • The file may have been removed
  • Temporary network issue
  • File may be too large

docs.title: Email notification not received
docs.text:
Symptoms: Members didn't receive email after publishing article

How to Fix:

  1. Check that Send notification was set to Yes when creating the article
  2. Verify members have email addresses in their profiles
  3. Check their email spam or junk folder
  4. Ask members to check their email preferences (unsubscribe setting)

Common Causes:

  • Notification was set to No instead of Yes
  • Members have opted out of email notifications
  • Email was filtered as spam

docs.title: Admin: Subgroup Membership
docs.text:
Owner access required

Only users with Owner access can manage subgroup membership.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This guide explains how subgroups affect what people can see, who gets notified, and who can review items. Use it when setting up groups and subgroups so the right people have the right access.

Note

This feature/guide is only useable if the associate is license for subgroups.

How to Access

From the main menu select Admin then Membership and Roles

Before You Start

Make sure you understand the access levels and roles, and how they apply at group and subgroup level.

  • User: Standard member with personal workspace access
  • Viewer: Can create assessments on other users and view subgroup folders
  • Reviewer: Can review diary and plan entries, run reports, and view subgroup folders
  • Trainer: Can manage exams (group-level only)
  • Communications: Can manage news articles (group-level only)
  • Files Manager: Can upload, delete, and organise files and folders
  • Owner: Full administrative control (group-level only)

docs.title: Membership and Permissions
docs.text:
Subgroups give you a way to narrow visibility and actions inside a group. People can have one level in the group and a different level in one or more subgroups.

  • Group level access applies across the whole group
  • Subgroup level access only applies within that subgroup
  • Owner is only available at group level (subgroups cannot have Owners)

docs.title: How to Manage Membership
docs.text:
1. Go to Admin > Membership and Roles
  2. Use the search box to find a group
  3. Click the group name to expand it
  4. Click a subgroup to expand it
  5. Click Add to add members or click a member to Edit their level
  6. Click Save
  7. Result: The membership list updates and you see confirmation messages

Tip

  • Use the role filter to quickly show members by role
  • You can remove a member using Remove on their row
  • At subgroup level, the Owner option is not available

docs.title: What happens with Notifications and Reviews
docs.text:
• Notifications: When a subgroup is selected, notifications go to group Owners and Reviewers, plus the subgroup’s Reviewers. If no subgroup is selected, only the group Owners and Reviewers are notified.
  • Reviews: Group-level Reviewers can review items across the whole group. Subgroup Reviewers can only review items for members of the same subgroup(s).

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: The diagrams below show which people can see, get notified, or review. Shapes inside the group show subgroup membership.

docs.title: Example 1: Group-level reviewer sees everything in the group
docs.text:
Hold "Alt" / "Option" to enable pan & zoom 
flowchart LR
  subgraph Group
    Trevor["Trevor Lee (User)"]
    Jane["Jane Smith (Viewer)"]
    Alice["Alice Brown (Reviewer)"]
    Mike["Mike Chan (Reviewer)"]
    Sarah["Sarah Kim (Reviewer)"]
    David["David Ng (Reviewer)"]
    subgraph Subgroup One
      Emma[Emma Park]
      Liam[Liam Reed]
    end
    subgraph Subgroup Two
      Noah[Noah Young]
      Ava[Ava Cole]
    end
    John["John Doe (Group Reviewer)"]
    John --> Trevor & Jane & Alice & Mike & Sarah & David & Emma & Liam & Noah & Ava
  end

Result: The group-level Reviewer can review for anyone in the group, including all subgroups.

docs.title: Example 2: Subgroup reviewer only sees their subgroup
docs.text:
Hold "Alt" / "Option" to enable pan & zoom 
flowchart TD
  subgraph Group
    Trevor["Trevor Lee (User)"]
    Jane["Jane Smith (Viewer)"]
    Alice["Alice Brown (Reviewer)"]
    Mike["Mike Chan (Reviewer)"]
    Sarah["Sarah Kim (Reviewer)"]
    David["David Ng (Reviewer)"]
    subgraph Subgroup One
      Emma[Emma Park]
      Liam[Liam Reed]
      Tom["Tom Walker (Reviewer - Subgroup One)"]
    end
    subgraph Subgroup Two
      Noah[Noah Young]
      Ava[Ava Cole]
    end
    Tom --> Emma & Liam
  end

Result: The subgroup Reviewer can review for members of Subgroup One only.

docs.title: Example 3: Assigning a reviewer from the wrong subgroup
docs.text:
Hold "Alt" / "Option" to enable pan & zoom 
flowchart LR
  subgraph Group
    subgraph Subgroup One
      John["John Doe (Assigned)"]
    end
    subgraph Subgroup Two
      Trevor["Trevor Lee (Reviewer)"]
    end
  end

Result: The Reviewer in Subgroup Two cannot be assigned to review for a member in Subgroup One. They do not appear as an available reviewer.

docs.title: Example 4: Reviewer in multiple subgroups
docs.text:
Hold "Alt" / "Option" to enable pan & zoom 
flowchart LR
  subgraph Group
    subgraph Subgroup One
      Emma[Emma Park]
    end
    subgraph Subgroup Two
      Noah[Noah Young]
    end
    Jane["Jane Smith (Reviewer - Subgroup One & Two)"]
    Jane --> Emma & Noah
  end

Result: The Reviewer can review for members in both subgroups they belong to.

docs.title: Example 5: Notifications when a subgroup is selected
docs.text:
Hold "Alt" / "Option" to enable pan & zoom 
flowchart LR
  subgraph Group
    Bob[Bob Owner]
    John["John Doe (Group Reviewer)"]
    subgraph Subgroup One
      Trevor["Trevor Lee (Subgroup Reviewer)"]
    end
  end

Result: If an entry is created for Subgroup One, notifications go to the group’s Owners and Reviewers and to Subgroup One’s Reviewers.

docs.title: Example 6: Notifications when no subgroup is selected
docs.text:
Hold "Alt" / "Option" to enable pan & zoom 
flowchart LR
  subgraph Group
    Bob[Bob Owner]
    John["John Doe (Group Reviewer)"]
    subgraph Subgroup One
      Trevor["Trevor Lee (Subgroup Reviewer)"]
    end
  end

Result: If no subgroup is selected, notifications go to the group’s Owners and Reviewers only. Subgroup Reviewers are not notified.

docs.title: Field Details and Messages
docs.text:
Required vs optional

  • Group level: User, Viewer, Reviewer, Trainer, Communications, Files Manager, Owner are available
  • Subgroup level: User, Viewer, Reviewer, Files Manager are available (Trainer, Communications, Owner are group-level only)

Common messages

  • "Member added." after saving a new member
  • "Permissions updated." after changing a level
  • "Member removed." after removing a member
  • "No groups found." if the search returns no results

Validation tips

  • Use at least 2 characters when searching
  • To add someone to a subgroup, they do not need to be in the parent group first (adding at subgroup level is allowed)

docs.title: Admin: User Management
docs.text:
Access Level

Owner access required

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Manage all users in your organisation through the User Management page. View user lists, search for members, edit user details, create new accounts, change user names, reset passwords, manage group membership, upload profile pictures, and export user data.

User accounts are managed through Microsoft Azure AD B2C for enhanced security.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text: Click Admin then User Management

docs.title: Page Layout
docs.text:
When you open the page you see:

Search and Filter Section

  • Search box to find users by name or username
  • Group filter dropdown if you manage multiple groups
  • Search and All Users buttons

Export Section

  • Export button to download user list as CSV

User List Table

  • User profile pictures
  • Full names
  • Email addresses and phone numbers
  • Group memberships
  • Edit and action buttons

docs.title: Search by Name or Username
docs.text:
To find specific users:

  1. Enter a name or username in the Search User box
  2. Click Search
  3. Result: Only matching users appear in the table

docs.title: Filter by Group
docs.text:
If you manage multiple groups:

  1. Click the Filter by Group dropdown
  2. Select a group
  3. Result: Only users from the selected group appear

docs.title: View All Users
docs.text:
To return to the full list:

  1. Click All Users
  2. Result: The complete user list displays

docs.title: Editing User Details
docs.text:
To update a user's information:

  1. Click Edit next to the user's name in the list
  2. The page switches to edit view showing the user's current information

You can update these sections:

docs.title: Address Section
docs.text:
Search Address

  • Type an address in the search box
  • Select from the dropdown suggestions
  • Result: Address fills automatically

Current Address

  • Shows the currently saved address
  • Read only display

Phone Numbers

  • Phone Number - Primary contact number
  • Work Number - Work contact number
  • Secondary Number - Additional contact number

docs.title: Personal Details Section
docs.text:
Secondary Email Address

  • Additional email for communications
  • User receives notifications at both primary and secondary emails

Shirt Size

  • Select size for uniform orders
  • Free text field

Pants Size

  • Select size for uniform orders
  • Free text field

Joined Your Group

  • Year the user joined
  • Dropdown selection

docs.title: About Me Section
docs.text:
Rich text editor for user biography:

  • Use formatting toolbar for bold, italic and lists
  • Add links and formatted text
  • Displays on user profile page

docs.title: Profile Picture Section
docs.text:
Only appears if the user belongs to groups where you have administrator access:

Upload Picture

  1. Click Upload Picture
  2. Select an image file
  3. Crop the image using the cropping tool
  4. Click Crop and Upload
  5. Result: Profile picture updates immediately

Image Requirements

  • Formats: JPG, PNG, GIF
  • Maximum size: 2 MB
  • Automatically cropped to square

Remove Picture

  1. Click Remove Picture
  2. Confirm the deletion
  3. Result: Picture is deleted and replaced with default avatar

Alternative Method

You can also delete profile pictures from the Media page, which allows you to manage multiple profile images at once or delete orphaned profile pictures.

Multiple Groups

If the user belongs to multiple groups:

  • Select which group to upload the picture for using the dropdown
  • Pictures are stored separately for each group

docs.title: Saving Changes
docs.text:
After making updates:

  1. Click Save Changes at the top or bottom of the page
  2. Result: Confirmation message appears and changes are saved
  3. Click Back to return to the user list

docs.title: Changing a User's Name
docs.text:
To change a user's first name or surname:

  1. Click Edit next to the user's name
  2. In the user information section, click Change Name
  3. A modal dialog opens
  4. Enter the new First Name (required)
  5. Enter the new Last Name (required)
  6. Read the warning about password recovery
  7. Click Update Name
  8. Result: Name is updated and username regenerates automatically

Name Validation

  • Names must contain only letters, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes
  • First letter of each word is automatically capitalised
  • Examples: John, Mary-Ann, O'Brien

Username Changes

When you change a user's name:

  • Username regenerates in firstname.surname format
  • If that username exists, a number is added (firstname.surname1)
  • User receives an email notification with the new username

Email Notifications

When you change a name:

  • User receives an email with their new name and username
  • You receive a confirmation email with the change details
  • Both emails include the password recovery warning

docs.title: Group Membership
docs.text:
To view and manage which groups a user belongs to:

  1. Click Edit next to the user's name
  2. Scroll to the Group Membership section
  3. A table shows:
    • Group name
    • Licences remaining in that group
    • User rights level
    • Actions

docs.title: Change User Rights
docs.text:
To change a user's access level in a group:

  1. Locate the group in the table
  2. Click the User Rights dropdown
  3. Select a new access level (Not Assigned, User, or Owner)
  4. Result: Access level updates immediately

Tip

For fine-grained role assignments (Viewer, Reviewer, Trainer, Communications, Files Manager), use the Membership and Roles page.

docs.title: Add User to a Group
docs.text:
To add the user to a new group:

  1. Scroll to the Group Membership section
  2. Groups where the user is not a member show an Add option
  3. Click the dropdown
  4. Select a rights level
  5. Result: User is added to the group

docs.title: Remove from Group
docs.text:
To remove a user from a group:

  1. Locate the group in the table
  2. Click the User Rights dropdown
  3. Select the empty option at the top
  4. Result: User is removed from the group

docs.title: Add Single User
docs.text:
To create one new user:

  1. Click Add User at the top of the page (if not visible, click Start Again first)
  2. The Create New User form appears
  3. Enter:
    • First Name (required) - Letters, hyphens and apostrophes only
    • Surname (required) - Letters, hyphens and apostrophes only
    • Email Address (required) - Valid email format
  4. Click Create User

What Happens Next

The system:

  • Creates account in Azure AD B2C with a secure password
  • Adds the user to your group
  • Sends a welcome email with username and temporary password
  • User receives email with login instructions
  • User should log in and change their password to one they will remember

Account Details

New accounts receive:

  • Username generated from email address or first and surname
  • Temporary password (random, secure)
  • Email with sign-in instructions
  • Access to your group
  • Standard user permissions (can be upgraded later)

What Happens Next - Flowchart

Hold "Alt" / "Option" to enable pan & zoom 
flowchart TD
  A[Enter First Name, Surname, Email] --> B{Valid details?}
  B -- No --> E[Show validation error]
  B -- Yes --> C{Email exists?}
  C -- No --> D1[Create new account in Azure AD B2C]
  D1 --> F1["Generate username"]
  D1 --> G1[Generate secure temporary password]
  D1 --> H1[Add to your group]
  D1 --> I1["Send welcome email"]
  C -- Yes --> C1{Account deleted?}
  C1 -- Yes --> D2[Restore account]
  D2 --> G2[Generate new temporary password]
  D2 --> H2[Add to your group]
  D2 --> I2["Send welcome email"]
  C1 -- No --> D3[Add existing user to your group]
  D3 --> J1[No new password needed]
  D3 --> I3[Send email: Added to new group]

New Email - Creates New Account

  • New account created in Azure AD B2C
  • Temporary password sent via email
  • User added to your group
  • User receives welcome email with username and login link

Existing Email - Active User

  • Existing user added to your group
  • No new password generated
  • User receives notification they're added to your group
  • You can now edit their details

Existing Email - Deleted User

  • Deleted account is restored
  • User is re-added to your group
  • New temporary password generates
  • Welcome email is sent

After Creation

Success message appears showing:

  • Username created
  • Full name

You can then:

  • Update group membership permissions
  • Add address and contact details
  • Upload profile picture
  • Add personal details

docs.title: Bulk Import Users
docs.text:
To add multiple users from a CSV file:

  1. Click Start Again if you are editing a user
  2. Look for the Bulk Import section or button
  3. Click Bulk Import
  4. Download the example CSV template
  5. Fill in your user data with three columns:
    • FirstName
    • Surname
    • Email
  6. Select your completed CSV file
  7. The file uploads in the upload frame
  8. Preview appears: Review all rows before importing
    • Valid rows show a green tick
    • Problem rows show a red error badge with details
    • Count badges show: valid count, error count, and total rows
  9. Check for errors: Fix any rows with issues in your CSV and re-upload if needed
  10. Click Import to create the users
  11. Result: System processes each row and shows results

CSV Format Example

FirstName,Surname,Email
John,Smith,john.smith@example.com
Jane,Doe,jane.doe@example.com

Validation

Each row must have:

  • First name starting with capital letter
  • Surname starting with capital letter
  • Valid email format
  • Email not already in use in the system

Preview Table

The preview shows a table with these columns:

  • #: Row number from the CSV
  • First Name: User's first name
  • Surname: User's surname
  • Email: User's email address
  • Status: Badge showing Valid, Warning, or Error
  • Detail: Explanation of any issue found

Results

After import completes:

  • Success count shows how many users were created
  • Error list shows which rows failed and why
  • Successfully created users receive welcome emails

Warning

Each imported user uses a licence seat. Ensure you have enough available licences before importing.

docs.title: Resetting User Passwords
docs.text:
You can reset a user's password when they forget it or need a temporary password.

Available for: Users with local password accounts (not social logins like Microsoft or Facebook)

To reset a user's password:

  1. Click Edit next to the user's name
  2. Locate the password reset option in the user actions
  3. Click Reset Password
  4. Confirm the reset in the dialog
  5. Result: New password generates and is emailed to the user

What Happens

  • Random 12-character password generates automatically
  • Password is securely sent to the user's email address
  • Email includes the new password and login instructions
  • User can log in immediately with the new password
  • User should change their password to something they'll remember

Email Content

The user receives:

  • Notification that an administrator reset their password
  • New temporary password
  • Link to sign in
  • Administrator name who performed the reset
  • Instructions to change their password

For Social Account Users (Microsoft, Facebook)

If a user signed up with a social provider:

  • The password reset button may not be available
  • They must reset their password through their social provider
  • Tell them to go to Microsoft Account, Facebook, etc. and change their password there
  • Their new password will work in Match Official System

docs.title: Deleting Users
docs.text:
To remove a user from the system:

  1. Click Edit next to the user's name
  2. Locate the delete user option
  3. Click Delete User
  4. Confirm the deletion
  5. Result: User account is marked as deleted

Warning

This action is permanent. The user is marked as deleted in the database. Their historical data like assessments remains but is no longer associated with an active account. By default, deleted user records are retained for 2 years and then removed from the database.

Before Deleting

Consider if you should:

  • Remove them from specific groups instead of deleting entirely
  • Lower their access level instead
  • Keep the account but inform the user they no longer have access

docs.title: Exporting Users
docs.text:
To download your complete user list:

  1. Click Export in the Export Users section
  2. Result: CSV file downloads to your computer

CSV Contents

The export includes:

  • Full name
  • Email address
  • Secondary email address
  • Complete address
  • Phone numbers (telephone, work, mobile)
  • Occupation
  • Year joined
  • Shirt size
  • Pant size
  • Groups the user belongs to
  • Last login date

File Naming

Downloads as: YYYYMMDD_MOSexport.csv

Uses

  • Audit records and compliance reporting
  • Import into other systems
  • Analysis and planning
  • Backup documentation
  • Licence verification

docs.title: Pagination
docs.text:
If you have many users:

  • 10 users display per page
  • Pagination controls appear at the bottom
  • Click page numbers to navigate
  • First, previous, next and last buttons available

docs.title: Multiple Group Management
docs.text:
If you administer multiple groups:

Group Filter

  • Filter dropdown appears in the search section
  • Select a group to view only its members
  • Select All Groups to view everyone

Multiple Groups Alert

If you belong to multiple groups with administrator access:

  • Alert banner appears at the top
  • Shows which groups you can manage
  • Helps you understand which users you can edit

docs.title: Validation Rules
docs.text:
First Name and Surname

  • Must start with a capital letter
  • Can only contain letters, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes
  • Examples: John, Mary-Ann, O'Brien, Di Angelo

Email Address

  • Must be valid email format
  • Must contain @ symbol
  • Must have domain extension
  • Examples: user@example.com, name.surname@domain.co.au

Phone Numbers

  • Can include numbers, spaces, dashes and plus signs
  • Spaces are automatically removed when saving
  • Examples: 0412345678, +61 412 345 678, 02-1234-5678

Address

  • Uses Google Places autocomplete
  • Select from dropdown suggestions
  • Saves as complete formatted address string

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
Best Practices

  • Update user details when they change employment or contact information
  • Export your user list regularly for backup purposes
  • Use bulk import for adding multiple users at once
  • Check licence availability before adding users
  • Use search to find users quickly in large lists
  • Remove users from groups they no longer need access to instead of deleting

When Changing Names

  • Inform the user before changing their name
  • Confirm spelling with the user
  • Tell them their username will change
  • Warn them about password recovery being disabled
  • Suggest they set a strong password they will remember

Profile Pictures

  • Upload clear professional photos
  • Use consistent image quality across your organisation
  • Images are cropped to squares automatically
  • File size affects page load speed

docs.title: Cannot Edit User
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Edit button is greyed out or missing
  • Error when clicking Edit

How to Fix

  1. Verify you have Owner access
  2. Check the user belongs to a group you administer
  3. Refresh the page
  4. Log out and log back in

Common Causes

  • Insufficient permissions
  • User belongs to a different group
  • Session expired

docs.title: Email Already Exists
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Cannot create new user
  • Error message about duplicate email

How to Fix

  1. Search for the email in your user list
  2. If found, edit that user instead
  3. If not found, the email may belong to a deleted account
  4. Contact system support if email is genuinely unused

Common Causes

  • Email already registered to active user
  • Email was used for deleted account
  • Typo in email address

docs.title: Bulk Import Errors
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Some rows fail to import
  • Error messages appear in results

How to Fix

  1. Check CSV format matches the template exactly
  2. Verify all email addresses are valid
  3. Remove any duplicate emails
  4. Check names start with capital letters
  5. Save file as CSV not Excel format
  6. Try uploading smaller batches

Common Causes

  • Invalid email format
  • Duplicate emails
  • Wrong file format
  • Special characters in names
  • Missing required columns

docs.title: Profile Picture Not Uploading
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Upload button does not work
  • Error message when uploading
  • Picture does not appear

How to Fix

  1. Check file size is under 2 MB
  2. Verify file format is JPG, PNG or GIF
  3. Try a different image file
  4. Check your internet connection
  5. Refresh the page and try again

Common Causes

  • File too large
  • Unsupported file format
  • Network connection issues
  • Browser cache problems

  • Group Settings - Configure your group

docs.title: Exams
docs.text:
Access Level

All users can sit exams. Exam management requires Trainer or Owner role.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Complete exams that have been assigned to you. Answer questions, submit your responses, and view your results. Exams may be graded automatically or by your administrator.

How to Access: Click Assessments then Exams

docs.title: Finding Your Exams
docs.text:
1. Open Assessments → Exams
  2. You see a list of exams assigned to you
  3. Exams show the title, due date, status, and actions available

Exam Status:

  • Not Started: You haven't opened this exam yet
  • In Progress: You started but didn't finish
  • Submitted: You completed and submitted the exam
  • Results Available: Your score and feedback are ready to view

docs.title: How to Start and Complete an Exam
Starting the Exam
docs.text:
1. Find your exam in the list
  2. Click Start or Resume (if continuing from in progress)
  3. A modal window shows the exam name and instructions
  4. Click Start exam to begin

docs.title: During the Exam
docs.text:
The exam screen shows:

  • Question number buttons at the top - click any number to jump to that question
  • Previous and Next buttons - navigate between questions
  • Countdown timer - shows remaining time in minutes and seconds
  • Pass mark - the score needed to pass this exam
  • Question content - read carefully and select your answer

docs.title: Answering Questions
docs.text:
1. Read the question carefully
  2. Select your answer based on the question type:
    • Single choice: Click one correct option
    • Multiple choice: Check all correct answers
    • True/False: Select True or False
  3. Your answer is marked automatically as you select it

docs.title: Moving Through the Exam
docs.text:
You can navigate in several ways:

  • Click a question number at the top to jump directly to that question
  • Click Previous to go back to the previous question
  • Click Next to move to the next question
  • Use arrow keys on your keyboard: Left arrow = Previous, Right arrow = Next
  • The buttons disable when you reach the first or last question

docs.title: Submitting Your Exam
docs.text:
1. When you finish all questions, click Submit exam
  2. Your answers are submitted
  3. If the exam is auto-graded, you see your score immediately with a pass/fail result
  4. You may be offered the chance to See answers or Resit exam (if allowed)

Tips:

  • Take your time; questions may require careful reading
  • Watch the countdown timer to pace yourself
  • Use the question number buttons to review answers before submitting
  • Ensure a stable internet connection before starting
  • Avoid closing the browser or navigating away mid-exam

docs.title: Exam Results
docs.text:
After submitting your exam:

  • Your Score displays immediately if auto-graded
  • A Pass/Fail badge shows whether you achieved the pass mark
  • The score shows both your percentage and raw score (points earned vs. total available)
  • Some exams include explanations for correct answers
  • Your administrator may publish additional feedback or comments

docs.title: How to Review Past Results
docs.text:
1. Go to Assessments → Exams
  2. Look for Previous Results or Completed section
  3. Click an exam to view your score and details
  4. Review any feedback or explanations provided
  5. Questions are marked as correct or incorrect
  6. You can see all your answers side by side with the correct answers

docs.title: Retake an Exam (if allowed)
docs.text:
1. Go to Assessments → Exams
  2. Find the exam you want to retake
  3. If a Retake button appears, click it
  4. Complete the exam again following the steps above
  5. Submit your new responses

Note

Not all exams allow retakes. Check with your administrator if you're unsure.

docs.title: Check Pass Mark and Attempts
docs.text:
1. Open the exam details or look at the exam list
  2. Review Pass Mark and Maximum Attempts (if shown)
  3. If uncertain, contact your administrator

docs.title: Understand Your Score
docs.text:
After your exam is marked, you see:

  • Percentage Score: Your percentage of correct answers
  • Raw Score: Total points earned vs. total available
  • Pass/Fail: Whether you achieved the required pass mark (shown as a badge)
  • Individual question review: See which answers were correct and which were incorrect

docs.title: Exam will not start
docs.text:
Symptoms: The Start button is grayed out or doesn't work

How to Fix:

  1. Verify you have an assigned exam
  2. Check the exam availability window (it may not be open yet)
  3. Check your internet connection
  4. Log out and back in, then try again
  5. Try a different browser
  6. Contact your administrator if the issue persists

Common Causes:

  • Exam window not yet open
  • Exam window has closed
  • You don't have access to this exam
  • Browser/connection issue

docs.title: Answers not saving
docs.text:
Symptoms: Your responses disappear when you move to the next question

How to Fix:

  1. Wait for pages to load fully before clicking Next
  2. Avoid using the browser Back button
  3. Check your internet connection
  4. If the problem repeats, report it to your administrator immediately

Common Causes:

  • Network connectivity issue
  • Page didn't load completely
  • Using browser navigation while exam is loading

docs.title: Unexpected logout during exam
docs.text:
Symptoms: You're logged out and sent to the login page during the exam

How to Fix:

  1. Log back in with your credentials
  2. Return to Assessments → Exams
  3. Your progress may have been saved; click Resume to continue
  4. If progress didn't save, contact your administrator

Common Causes:

  • Session timeout due to inactivity
  • Network issue causing logout
  • System maintenance

docs.title: Can't submit the exam
docs.text:
Symptoms: Submit button is grayed out or doesn't work

How to Fix:

  1. Verify you have answered the questions you want to submit
  2. Click Submit exam button in the top right
  3. Check your internet connection
  4. Try again in a few moments
  5. Contact your administrator if submission fails repeatedly

Common Causes:

  • Network connectivity issue
  • Page didn't load completely
  • System timeout

docs.title: Time running out
docs.text:
Symptoms: The countdown timer shows you only have a few seconds left, or displays "Time is up!"

How to Fix:

  1. If time is running out, finish answering your remaining questions
  2. If time has run out, a modal appears automatically
  3. Click Submit exam in the modal to save your responses
  4. Any answered questions will be graded based on your answers
  5. Unanswered questions will count as incorrect

Tips:

  • Watch the countdown timer throughout the exam
  • Pace yourself to ensure you complete as many questions as possible
  • The timer shows both minutes and seconds remaining

docs.title: Assessments and Reviews: Manage Your Development
docs.text:
Access Level

All users

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Create and manage your Diary and Plan entries, and view reviews and assessments assigned to you. Use bulk actions to keep things tidy and export your data when needed.

How to Access: Click Assessments

docs.title: My Assessments
docs.text:
A list of your match-related assessments and reviews.

  • Shows subject, date, association, status, and whether you have viewed it.
  • Use the pager to browse older items.

docs.title: Bulk actions
docs.text:
• Mark as read: Acknowledges reviewed items that you haven’t viewed yet.
  • Revert to confidential: Moves an item back to your private view (when allowed).
  • Delete: Removes your own entries that are not assigned assessments.

Result: A success banner confirms how many items were updated or skipped.

docs.title: My Plans
docs.text:
Personal planning entries (goals, actions, timeframes) with reviewer feedback when applicable.

  • Shows date, description, review state, and whether you have viewed it.

docs.title: Bulk actions
docs.text:
• Mark as read: Acknowledges reviewed plans you haven’t viewed yet.
  • Archive: Moves plans to your archive to keep your main list focused.
  • Revert to confidential: Returns a plan to your private draft state (when allowed).
  • Delete: Removes selected plans.

Result: A success banner confirms how many items were updated or skipped.

docs.title: Create a Diary Entry
docs.text:
1. Click New diary entry.
  2. Select the appropriate template if prompted.
  3. Enter the match context and complete the sections provided.
  4. Save as a Draft or Submit as directed.

Result: The entry appears in your list. When reviewed, you can mark it as read.

docs.title: Using Autocomplete for Teams and Venues
docs.text:
When you enter Team A, Team B, or Venue information:

  • Start typing the team or venue name
  • After 3 characters, matching suggestions appear in a dropdown list
  • Click a suggestion to fill in the field automatically
  • This helps ensure consistent naming and reduces typing

Suggestions are drawn from teams and venues previously used in your group.

docs.title: Create a Plan
docs.text:
1. Click New plan entry.
  2. Add goals, actions, and any due dates.
  3. Save your plan; update over time as you progress.

Result: The plan appears in your list. When reviewed, you can mark it as read or archive it later.

docs.title: Create a Peer Review
docs.text: Peer reviews allow you to provide feedback on a colleague's performance (if your association enables this feature).

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
• Peer reviews may not be enabled for all associations
  • Check if the New peer review button is visible on your My Assessments page
  • Contact your administrator if you're unsure whether peer reviews are available

docs.title: How to Create a Peer Review
docs.text:
1. On the Assessments page, look for the New peer review button
  2. If the button is greyed out or missing, peer reviews are not enabled for your association
  3. Click New peer review
  4. Select the colleague you want to review
  5. Complete the peer review template (specific fields depend on your association)
  6. Choose how to submit:
    • Draft: Save privately; you can edit later
    • Submit for Review: Send to administrators for publication; they can add comments before sharing with the colleague
  7. Click Save

Result: Your peer review is created and appears in your list.

docs.title: After Submission
docs.text:
• Draft peer reviews: Only you can see them
  • Submitted peer reviews: Administrators review and publish before the colleague sees them
  • Published peer reviews: The colleague receives an email notification and can view your feedback
  • Your colleague can then view your feedback in their My Assessments list marked as a peer review

docs.title: Viewing Peer Reviews You Received
docs.text:
When a colleague creates a peer review for you:

  1. You receive an email notification (if enabled)
  2. The peer review appears in your My Assessments list
  3. Open it to see your colleague's feedback
  4. Mark as read to acknowledge you have reviewed it
  5. Your colleague's name is shown as the reviewer

docs.title: View a Review or Assessment
docs.text:
1. Open an item from My Assessments.
  2. Review original notes (Diary/Plan) and any reviewer ratings/comments.
  3. If media is included, download the file or open the shared link (e.g., MOS upload, YouTube, Dropbox, OneDrive).
  4. If prompted, marking it as viewed acknowledges that you have read the review.

Result: The item’s state updates accordingly and may notify your reviewer (where enabled).

docs.title: Submit Feedback on an Assessment
docs.text: After viewing a completed assessment, you may be able to submit feedback to the reviewer (if your group has enabled this feature).

docs.title: When You Can Submit Feedback
docs.text:
• The assessment must be in Reviewed status (completed by the reviewer)
  • Your group must have assessment feedback enabled
  • You can only submit feedback once per assessment
  • Once submitted, feedback cannot be edited or deleted

docs.title: How to Submit Feedback
docs.text:
1. Open the assessment from your My Assessments list
  2. Scroll to the Your Feedback section (appears near the bottom)
  3. Enter your feedback in the text field
  4. Your feedback can be up to 4000 characters
  5. Click Submit Feedback

Result: The feedback appears with a submitted date. The reviewer receives a notification (if enabled).

docs.title: If You Cannot See the Feedback Section
docs.text:
• Your group may not have feedback enabled — contact your administrator
  • You may have already submitted feedback on this assessment (only one submission allowed)
  • The assessment may not be in completed status yet

docs.title: Export My Data
docs.text:
Download your lists to CSV for your records.

  • Export assessments: Downloads your assessments list.
  • Export plans: Downloads your plans list.

Tip

For larger exports or admin-level raw data, see Group Reporting.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Bulk action skipped: The item’s current state may not allow that action.
  • Media link not working: Try again on a stable connection; some links open in external services.
  • Can’t find my item: Clear filters, check paging, or widen your date range where available.

docs.title: Response States (Assessments & Diary Entries)
docs.text:
Your assessments and diary entries move through different states as they're created, reviewed, and published. Each state controls what you can do with the entry.

State Colour Meaning What You Can Do Confidential Your private draft, not sent for review Edit, delete, submit for review Awaiting Review You submitted it, waiting for admin feedback View only, cannot edit Reviewed Admin published feedback for you to read View, mark as read, revert to confidential (if allowed in group settings) View Only Shared for reading (no feedback included) View, mark as read, revert to confidential (if allowed in group settings) Assessment Assigned to you by an admin View only, cannot delete (can submit feedback response if enabled) Assessment Replied You have submitted feedback on the assessment View only, cannot edit your feedback Draft Assessment Assessment saved as draft (not yet published) View, cannot edit or delete

docs.title: Response States (Plans)

docs.title: Forgot Password: Recover Your Account
docs.text:
Access Level

Public (before authentication)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
If you forget your password, you can reset it through a secure recovery process using your email address and a secret question.

How to Access: On the sign in page, click Forgot my password

docs.title: How to Reset Your Password
docs.text: The password recovery process has three steps:

docs.title: Step 1: Enter Your Email or Username
docs.text:
1. On the sign-in page, click Forgot my password
  2. Enter your email address or username
  3. Click Next

Field:

  • Email Address or Username (required): Enter the email or username associated with your account

Validation:

  • Must match an account in the system
  • Email must be in valid format (name@domain.com)
  • Case-insensitive

Errors:

  • "Account not found": Check for typos; try your email or username (whichever you didn't use); contact your administrator if your account doesn't exist

docs.title: Step 2: Answer Your Secret Question
docs.text:
1. Your saved secret question appears on the screen
  2. Enter the secret answer you provided during account setup
  3. Click Submit

Field:

  • Secret Answer (required): The answer to your security question

Validation:

  • Answers are case-sensitive; match your original capitalisation
  • Remove extra spaces and leading/trailing whitespace
  • Must match exactly what you entered when you created your account

Tips:

  • ✅ Think carefully about how you originally answered
  • ✅ If you have alternate spellings in mind, try each one
  • ✅ Note: "Fluffy" ≠ "fluffy" - case matters!

Common Issues:

  • "Incorrect answer": The answer doesn't match your saved answer. Try alternate spellings or capitalisation. If unsure, contact your administrator.
  • "No secret question set": Your account may not have security question set up. Contact your association administrator for password reset.
  • "Self-service password recovery is currently disabled": Password recovery was disabled when your name was changed. Contact your administrator to reset your password.

docs.title: Step 3: Receive Your New Temporary Password
docs.text:
1. A new temporary password is generated
  2. The password is sent to your registered email address
  3. Check your email for a message from Match Official System
  4. Your email will contain your new temporary password
  5. Copy the temporary password from the email
  6. Return to the sign in page
  7. Sign in with your email and the temporary password
  8. Result: You'll be prompted to change your password on first sign-in

Password Requirements:

When you sign in and change from your temporary password, your new password must meet these criteria:

  • Minimum 8 characters
  • At least one uppercase letter (A-Z)
  • At least one lowercase letter (a-z)
  • At least one number (0-9)
  • Symbols recommended (!@#$%)

Creating a Strong Password:

  • ✅ Use a unique password for this system
  • ✅ Mix uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols
  • ✅ Avoid personal information (name, birthday, etc.)
  • ✅ Don't reuse passwords from other sites
  • ✅ Use a password manager to generate and store passwords

Avoid:

  • ❌ Common words or phrases ("password", "welcome")
  • ❌ Sequential numbers (123456)
  • ❌ Keyboard patterns (qwerty)
  • ❌ Your name or personal information
  • ❌ Words found in a dictionary

docs.title: If You Don't Receive the Reset Email
docs.text:
Check Spam/Junk Folder:

  • MOS emails may be filtered as spam
  • Search for sender: Match Official System
  • Check all tabs (Primary, Promotions, Social, etc.)
  • Move email to inbox and mark as "Not Spam"

Email Hasn't Arrived:

  1. Wait 5-10 minutes for delivery
  2. Ask your IT to allowlist the domain
  3. Check that you entered your correct email address
  4. Try the password recovery process again

Contact Your Administrator:

If emails still don't arrive, contact your association administrator:

  1. Explain that password reset emails aren't reaching you
  2. Ask them to manually reset your password
  3. They may:
    • Reset your password to a temporary one
    • Send you a temporary password via another method
    • Help you update your email address if it's incorrect

docs.title: When Password Recovery is Disabled
docs.text:
In some situations, self-service password recovery is not available.

Why Password Recovery Gets Disabled:

Password recovery is disabled if:

  • Your name was changed by an administrator
  • An administrator manually disabled it for security reasons
  • Your account has unusual activity

docs.title: If Password Recovery is Disabled
docs.text:
You'll See:

"Self-service password recovery is currently disabled for your account"

How to Reset Your Password:

  1. Contact your association administrator
  2. Tell them your password recovery is disabled
  3. They can:
    • Manually reset your password
    • Send you a temporary password
    • Re-enable password recovery
  4. Sign in with the temporary password your administrator provides
  5. Change your password immediately: My Account → Change Password

Why This Happens:

When your name changes (even if you do it yourself):

  • Your username may change
  • Your security settings are re-verified to protect your account
  • Self-service recovery is temporarily disabled

This is a security feature to prevent unauthorised account access.

docs.title: Account Not Found
docs.text:
Problem: "Account not found" message

What this means:

  • No account matches the email or username you entered
  • You may have:
    • Entered a typo
    • Used a different email than registered
    • Not registered yet

Solutions:

  1. Double-Check Entry:

    • Try your email address (if you used username)
    • Try your username (if you used email)
    • Check for typos

  2. Try Email Recovery:

    • Go to your email provider
    • Search for emails from "Match Official System"
    • Check any password reset or confirmation emails
    • The email in those messages is your registered email

  3. Contact Administrator:

    • Tell them you can't find your account
    • Ask them to search for you in their user list
    • They can verify if an account exists
    • They can manually reset your password

docs.title: Wrong Secret Answer
docs.text:
Problem: "Incorrect answer" - you know your answer but it doesn't work

Common Causes:

  • Capitalisation: Answers are case-sensitive. "Red" ≠ "red"
  • Extra spaces: Even one extra space means it won't match
  • Different spelling: You may have typed it differently originally
  • Memory: You may have misremembered how you answered

What to Try:

  1. Try Different Capitalisation:

    • Original: "Boston" → Try: "boston" or "BOSTON"
    • Original: "French Bulldog" → Try: "french bulldog"

  2. Try Without Spaces:

    • Original: "New York" → Try: "newyork"

  3. Try Alternate Spellings:

    • Original: "Fluffy" → Try: "Fluffy" (if you type with extra letters)

  4. Contact Administrator:

    • If multiple attempts fail
    • They can reset your password without needing the secret answer
    • They may help you update your secret question

docs.title: Email Address No Longer Valid
docs.text:
Problem: Password reset emails aren't reaching you; your email changed

Solutions:

  1. Update Your Email:

    • If you can still sign in, go to My Account → Update Email
    • Change to a current email address
    • Then password recovery will work

  2. Contact Administrator:

    • Tell them your email is outdated
    • Ask them to:
      • Update your email address in the system
      • Manually reset your password
    • Once updated, password recovery will work normally

docs.title: Tips for Password Recovery Success
docs.text:
• ✅ Use a unique, strong password
  • ✅ Write your secret question and answer in a secure password manager
  • ✅ Keep your registered email address active and monitored
  • ✅ Update your email if it changes
  • ✅ Change your password every 90 days
  • ✅ Never share your password with anyone

docs.text:

  • Register - Create a new account
  • Change Password - Change your password while signed in
  • Admin User Management - Administrators resetting passwords

docs.title: Sign In: Access Your Account
docs.text:
Access Level

Public (before authentication)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Sign in to access your Match Official System account using your email address. Your account uses Microsoft Azure AD B2C for secure authentication.

How to Access: Go to matchofficialsystem.com and the sign-in page appears by default.

Note

If you do not have an account, contact your association administrator for an invitation

docs.title: How to Sign In
docs.text:
1. Go to matchofficialsystem.com
  2. The sign in page appears
  3. Enter your email address (or username if you remember it)
  4. Click Next
  5. Result: You are redirected to Microsoft Azure AD B2C

In Azure AD B2C:

  1. Enter your password
  2. Optional: Check Keep me signed in to stay signed in longer (up to 3 months on trusted devices)
  3. Click Sign In
  4. Result: You are authenticated and returned to Match Official System

After Sign In:

  • You are signed in and taken to the Home page
  • Your session is active for 50 minutes of inactivity

Fields:

  • Email Address (required): Your registered email address or username
  • Password (required in Azure AD B2C): Your account password
  • Forgot my password: Click to start password recovery (see Forgot Password below)
  • Keep me signed in (optional): Extends your session to 3 months on trusted devices

Validation:

  • Email must be valid format (name@domain.com)
  • Password is case-sensitive
  • Spaces at beginning and end are removed automatically

Errors:

  • "Account not found": Check for typos in your email; try your username
  • "Incorrect password": Verify Caps Lock is off; try password recovery
  • Account temporarily locked: You may have entered incorrect password multiple times - wait a few minutes and try again

docs.title: Keep Me Signed In
docs.text:
When you check Keep me signed in in Azure AD B2C, your session is extended.

How it works:

  • Your session extends to 3 months on the current device
  • Uses secure cookies to maintain authentication
  • Your login status is preserved across browser sessions

When to use it:

  • On your personal computer
  • On your personal phone
  • When you use the system frequently
  • On devices you trust

When NOT to use it:

  • On shared computers
  • On public computers (libraries, airports, schools)
  • When using someone else's device
  • On computers at work shared with others

Security: Your authentication is protected by Microsoft Azure AD B2C enterprise security.

docs.title: Session Timeout
docs.text:
Your session ends automatically after a period of inactivity to protect your account.

What happens:

  • After 50 minutes of inactivity, your session expires
  • You are automatically signed out
  • Unsaved changes can be lost if your session expires

How to stay signed in:

  • Check Keep me signed in on the login page (3 month session)
  • Actively use the system (refresh activity timer)
  • Save your work regularly

If you're signed out:

  1. Go to matchofficialsystem.com
  2. Sign in with your email and password
  3. You'll be returned to the system

Tip: Save your work regularly to avoid losing changes when your session ends.

docs.title: Forgot Your Password
docs.text: If you forget your password, you can reset it.

docs.title: How to Reset Your Password
docs.text:
1. On the sign-in page, click Forgot my password
  2. Enter your email address
  3. Click Next
  4. You'll be directed to a secure password reset process
  5. Follow the on-screen instructions to create a new password

See Forgot Password for detailed instructions.

docs.title: Account Lockout
docs.text: If you enter the wrong password several times, your account may be temporarily locked for security.

docs.title: If Your Account Is Locked
docs.text:
1. Wait a few minutes before trying again
  2. Your account will automatically unlock
  3. Try signing in again with the correct password
  4. If locked again, use Forgot my password to reset
  5. Contact your administrator if you need immediate help

Why this happens: Multiple failed password attempts trigger a temporary security lockout to protect against brute force attacks. This is normal and your account automatically recovers.

docs.title: Maintenance Mode
docs.text:
During scheduled maintenance, you may not be able to sign in.

What you see:

  • A maintenance notice on the sign in page
  • A message preventing you from signing in

What to do:

  • Wait and try again later
  • Check association communications for updates

docs.title: Signing Out
docs.text:
When you're finished using the system, sign out to protect your account.

How to Sign Out:

  1. Click your profile name or avatar in the top-right corner
  2. Click Sign Out
  3. Result: You are signed out and return to the sign-in page

docs.title: Can't sign in
docs.text:
1. Use Forgot my password to reset your password
  2. Check your Caps Lock is off
  3. Verify there are no extra spaces before or after your username
  4. Clear your browser cookies and try again

docs.title: Don't know your username
docs.text:
1. Contact your association administrator to confirm your username
  2. Use Forgot my password if you prefer to reset

docs.title: New device not recognised
docs.text:
1. Complete sign-in normally
  2. If prompted, verify your email address
  3. You may need additional verification on first login from a new device

docs.title: Page loops after sign-in
docs.text:
Symptoms: You sign in but return to the login page

How to Fix:

  1. Clear your browser cookies and cache
  2. Try a different browser
  3. Try disabling browser extensions
  4. Contact your administrator if the problem continues

docs.title: Still can't sign in
docs.text:
1. Verify you have an active account with your association
  2. Check your internet connection is stable
  3. Try the system on a different network
  4. Contact your administrator for help

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Use a password manager for strong, unique passwords
  • ✅ Enable email notifications and keep your email updated
  • ✅ Log out from shared devices after each session
  • ❌ Don't use "Keep me signed in" on shared devices
  • ❌ Don't share your password with anyone
