Public (with invitation link required)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Registration uses Microsoft Azure AD B2C to create your account securely. You'll receive an invitation link from your association, then set up your account through a simple process.

How to Access: Click the registration link in your invitation email

Warning

You cannot self-register without an invitation link. Contact your association administrator if you need access

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
Requirements:

  • Valid email address (personal or work)
  • Registration link from your association administrator
  • Access to your email for account creation

How you'll receive your link:

Your administrator will share the link via:

  • Email
  • Chat or messaging app
  • Document or shared workspace
  • Phone or in-person meeting
  • Any method your administrator chooses

docs.title: Invitation Links
docs.text:
Your association administrator generates registration links when they want to allow people to sign up. Each link is unique to your group and doesn't expire.

Important: If your administrator disables and then re-enables registrations, the link changes. Ask your administrator for the current link.

docs.title: Group Association
docs.text:
When you click the registration link, you'll see your association's:

  • Group logo
  • Association name
  • Group information

This confirms you're registering for the correct organisation.

docs.title: Step 1: Get Your Registration Link
docs.text:
Your association administrator will provide you with a registration link. They may share it by:

  • Email
  • Team messaging platform (Slack, Microsoft Teams, etc.)
  • Document or shared drive
  • SMS or phone call
  • In person

The registration link is unique to your group and typically looks like this: https://matchofficialsystem.com/register?ID=YourUniqueGroupCode

For example: https://matchofficialsystem.com/register?ID=951a632a-1e4d-4368-89e7-776c08b10acd

docs.title: Step 2: Click Your Registration Link
docs.text:
1. When you're ready to register, click the registration link your administrator shared
  2. Your browser opens the MOS registration page
  3. You'll see your association's logo and name, confirming you have the correct link
  4. Click Next to begin registration
  5. You'll be redirected to Microsoft Azure AD B2C to create your account

If Your Link Doesn't Work:

  • Your administrator may have disabled registrations and then re-enabled them (this changes the link)
  • Contact your association administrator for the current link
  • They can provide you with the updated registration link

docs.title: Step 3: Create Your Account in Azure AD B2C
docs.text:
You're now in Microsoft Azure AD B2C, which handles account creation securely.

Enter Your Email:

  1. Enter your email address

    • Use an email you have permanent access to
    • Can be personal (gmail.com, outlook.com) or work email
    • Example: firstname.lastname@company.com

  2. Create a password

    • Minimum 8 characters
    • Include uppercase letters (A-Z)
    • Include lowercase letters (a-z)
    • Include numbers (0-9)
    • Symbols recommended (!@#$%)
    • Example: MySecure123!Pass

Important: Your email and password are used to sign in every time. Remember them.

  1. Provide your name

    • Given Name: Your first/given name
    • Surname: Your family/last name

  2. Click Create to complete account creation

What happens next:

  • Your account is created in Azure AD B2C
  • You're automatically signed in
  • You're returned to Match Official System
  • You're taken to the Home page

docs.title: Step 4: Welcome to Match Official System
docs.text:
You're now signed in and can:

  • View the Home dashboard
  • Access news and announcements
  • Start assigned work
  • Explore the system

Next Steps:

  1. Update Your Profile: Click My Account → Update Profile to add details like address and phone number
  2. Change Your Password: Click My Account → Change Password if you want a different password
  3. Contact Your Administrator: If you need help or have questions about your access level

docs.title: Registration Link Issues
docs.text:
Problem: Registration link doesn't work

What to try:

  1. Check the URL:

    • Ensure you copied the entire link correctly
    • Check for spaces or line breaks if pasted from email or another source
    • Try clicking the link directly instead of copying and pasting

  2. Link Changed:

    • If your administrator disabled and then re-enabled registrations, the link changes
    • Ask your administrator for the current registration link
    • They can provide you with the updated link immediately

  3. Group No Longer Exists:

    • The association may have been deactivated or removed
    • Contact the administrator who sent you the link for clarification

docs.title: Registrations Closed
docs.text:
Problem: "Registrations are currently closed for this group" or "License limit reached"

What this means:

  • Your association stopped allowing new registrations
  • Your association reached its user limit
  • Contact your administrator to:
    • Reopen registrations
    • Increase the user limit
    • Add you manually

docs.title: Email Already Registered
docs.text:
Problem: During Azure AD B2C registration, you get "This email is already in use"

What this means:

  • An account with this email already exists in the system
  • You may have registered previously
  • Someone else may be using this email

Solutions:

  1. Try Signing In:

    • Go to matchofficialsystem.com
    • Click Sign In (not Register)
    • Use your email and password

  2. Forgot Password:

    • Click "Forgot my password"
    • Reset your password
    • Sign in with your new password

  3. Use Different Email:

    • If you must use a different email, start the registration link again
    • Enter a different email address
    • After account creation, you can update your email in Profile settings

  4. Contact Administrator:

    • Tell them the email address that's registered
    • They can verify your account status
    • They can reset your password if needed

docs.title: Password Too Weak
docs.text:
Problem: "Password does not meet complexity requirements"

Azure AD B2C requires:

  • Minimum 8 characters (you entered too few)
  • At least one uppercase letter (A-Z)
  • At least one lowercase letter (a-z)
  • At least one number (0-9)
  • Symbols recommended: !@#$%^&*

Examples of strong passwords:

  • ✅ MySecure123!Pass
  • ✅ Summer2024@Beach
  • ✅ Hockey#Team99

Passwords to avoid:

  • ❌ password123 (too common)
  • ❌ 12345678 (all numbers)
  • ❌ ABCDEFGH (all letters, no numbers)
  • ❌ abc123 (too short)
  • ❌ Your name or birthday

docs.title: Account Creation Fails
docs.text:
Problem: You get an error during account creation

What to try:

  1. Clear Browser Cache:

    • Close your browser completely
    • Clear cache and cookies
    • Restart your browser
    • Click the registration link again

  2. Try Different Browser:

    • Try Chrome, Firefox, or Edge
    • Browser extensions may interfere
    • Try disabling extensions

  3. Check Email Format:

    • Must be valid format: name@domain.com
    • No spaces or special characters except @
    • Example: john.smith@company.com

  4. Wait and Retry:

    • If there's a system issue, wait 5-10 minutes
    • Try the registration link again
    • Contact your administrator if it keeps failing

docs.title: After Registration
docs.text: Once your account is created, you're signed in and ready to use the system.

docs.title: First Things to Do
docs.text:
1. Explore the Home Page:

    • View the dashboard

    • Check assigned work or assessments

  2. Update Your Profile (Optional):

    • Click My Account → Update Profile
    • Add your address, phone number, and other details
    • Upload a profile picture
    • Choose your preferred theme

  3. Change Your Password (Optional):

    • You can change your password anytime
    • Click My Account → Change Password
    • Your password is shared across the system

  4. Contact Your Administrator:

    • If you have questions about your access
    • If you need a different role or permissions
    • For onboarding or setup instructions

  • ✅ Keep your password secure and don't share it

docs.title: When To Contact Support
docs.text:
Contact support when:

  • The same error repeats after retrying
  • You can't access a page you believe you should see

How to contact support:

To help us diagnose the issue, provide:

docs.title: How do I reset my password?
docs.text:
1. Go to the sign-in page
  2. Click Forgot my password
  3. Enter your email address
  4. Answer your secret security question
  5. Check your email for a temporary password
  6. Sign in with the temporary password
  7. You'll be prompted to set a new permanent password

For detailed instructions, see Forgot Password.

docs.title: Can I sign in with my Microsoft or Google account?
docs.text:
Yes! You can link your Microsoft or Google account to your Match Official System account:

  1. Sign in with your regular password first
  2. Go to My Account → Profile Settings
  3. Find the Linked Accounts section
  4. Click Link Microsoft Account or Link Google Account
  5. After linking, you can sign in using the social login buttons on the login page

For more details, see Linked Accounts.

docs.title: How do I change my email address?
docs.text:
You can change your own email address:

  1. Sign in to your account
  2. Go to My Account → Update Email
  3. Enter your new email address
  4. Confirm with your current password
  5. Your email will be updated

See Update Email for step-by-step instructions.

docs.title: How do I change my password?
docs.text:
If you know your current password:

  1. Sign in to your account
  2. Go to My Account → Change Password
  3. Enter your current password
  4. Enter your new password twice
  5. Click Save

Note: If you signed in with Microsoft or Google (social account), you must change your password through that provider, not in Match Official System.

See Change Password for more information.

docs.title: Can I have different profile pictures for different groups?
docs.text: Yes. If you belong to multiple groups, you can set different pictures for each group through your profile settings.

docs.title: Unsubscribe from emails
docs.text: My Account → Profile Details → set "Unsubscribe from MOS automated emails?" to Yes.

docs.title: Upload media to reviews
docs.text: Use assessment upload areas or link to external sources (YouTube, Dropbox, OneDrive) with view-only share links.

docs.title: How do I register for an account?
docs.text:
You need an invitation link from your association administrator:

  1. Your administrator will share a registration link with you (via email, chat, document, etc.)
  2. Click the link
  3. You'll be taken to Azure AD B2C to create your account
  4. Enter your email and create a password
  5. Your account is created and you can sign in

See Register: Create Your Account for detailed instructions.

docs.title: Why can't I self-register?
docs.text: Registration requires an invitation from your association administrator. This ensures only authorized members can create accounts and helps maintain licensing compliance.

docs.title: The registration link isn't working
docs.text:
If your registration link doesn't work:

  • Check if signup is enabled: The link changes when your administrator disables and re-enables signup. Ask for the current link.
  • Try a different browser: Clear your cache or use incognito/private mode
  • Contact your administrator: They can provide a fresh link or check if signup is currently enabled

docs.title: Email validation errors
docs.text: Error Solution "Email addresses do not match" Carefully re-enter both fields; check for extra spaces "Not a valid email address" Ensure email is in valid format (name@domain.com) "Email already exists" This email is registered; use sign in or password recovery "Password does not meet requirements" Must be 8+ characters with uppercase, lowercase, and number

docs.title: What are the password requirements?
docs.text:
Your password must meet these Azure AD B2C requirements:

  • Minimum 8 characters
  • At least one uppercase letter (A-Z)
  • At least one lowercase letter (a-z)
  • At least one number (0-9)
  • Symbols are recommended (!@#$%) but not required

docs.title: I forgot to set up my security question
docs.text:
Your security question is required for password recovery. If you didn't set it up during registration:

  1. Sign in to your account
  2. Go to My Account → Change Password
  3. Set up your security question and answer
  4. This will enable self-service password recovery

See Change Password for instructions.

For detailed registration help, see Register: Create Your Account.

docs.title: Can we start with fewer users and add later?
docs.text: Yes. You can start with one 50‑user block and purchase additional blocks as you grow. Costs are typically pro rata if you add users mid‑year.

docs.title: What happens if we exceed our user limit?
docs.text: Contact your administrator or Cortana Design immediately. You'll need to purchase additional user blocks to continue adding members.

docs.title: Are subgroups required?
docs.text: No. You can operate with no subgroups (everyone in one group). Subgroups are optional and help organise larger associations.

docs.title: Can we customise the number of users per block?
docs.text: Standard pricing uses 50‑user blocks. Contact Cortana Design to discuss custom licensing arrangements.

docs.title: What support is included?
docs.text: Support includes access to this documentation, email support and assistance with technical issues. Premium support may be available for an additional cost.

docs.title: Is there a trial period?
docs.text: Contact Cortana Design to enquire about trial licences or pilot programmes.

docs.title: Can we change our subscription mid‑year?
docs.text:
Yes. You can add users, subgroups or features mid‑year with pro rata costs. Reductions may be refunded or credited towards the next period.

For detailed subscription information, see Licensing and Subscription.

Access Level

Access depends on where the link appears

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Download files and media provided throughout the site. Files are stored in the library or attached to items such as news posts, assessments, and reports.

How to Access: Click a download link or media thumbnail wherever it appears throughout the system

docs.title: Understanding File Links
docs.text:
Files can appear in many places:

  • News articles (news-attached documents)
  • Assessment feedback (evidence and media)
  • Library folders (managed files and folders)
  • Reports (export files)
  • Email notifications (linked resources)

docs.title: Single Click Download
docs.text:
1. Locate the file you want to download
  2. Click the file name
  3. Your browser's download dialog appears
  4. Choose a save location or accept the default (usually Downloads folder)
  5. Click Save or Download
  6. Result: The file downloads to your computer

docs.title: Browser Behavior
docs.text:
Different browsers handle downloads differently:

  • Chrome: Auto-downloads to Downloads folder by default
  • Firefox: Asks where to save or uses Downloads folder
  • Edge: Auto-downloads or asks, depending on settings
  • Safari: Opens download dialog or saves automatically

Tip: Check your browser's download settings to customise where files are saved.

docs.title: Large File Downloads
docs.text:
For files over 10 MB:

  1. Ensure you have a stable internet connection
  2. Use Wi-Fi rather than mobile data if possible
  3. Allow extra time for the download to complete
  4. Do not close your browser until the download is finished

Common Download Sizes:

  • Documents (PDF, Word): 1-5 MB
  • Spreadsheets: 2-10 MB
  • Images and photos: 2-8 MB
  • Video files: 50 MB to 2+ GB
  • Compressed archives (ZIP): Variable

docs.title: Download from News Articles
docs.text:
1. Go to News
  2. Click Read more on an article
  3. Look for attachment links or a download section
  4. Click the file name or Download button
  5. Result: The file downloads

docs.title: Download Assessment Evidence
docs.text:
1. Go to Assessments
  2. Open an assessment or review
  3. Look for attached evidence or media files
  4. Click Download next to the file
  5. Result: The file downloads

docs.title: Download from Library (Media or Folders)
docs.text:
1. Go to Library → Folders or Media
  2. Navigate to the file you want
  3. Click the file name or Download button
  4. Result: The file downloads

For multiple files: Select files and click Download Selected to download as a ZIP archive (if enabled).

docs.title: Download Reports or Exports
docs.text:
1. Go to Reporting or an admin report page
  2. Click Export this data to CSV or similar button
  3. A CSV file downloads
  4. Open in Excel, Sheets, or a text editor
  5. Result: You can view, edit, and analyze the data

docs.title: Open Downloaded Files
docs.text:
After downloading, find your file:

  1. Click the browser's Downloads button (⬇️)
  2. Or check your Downloads folder:
    • Windows: C:\Users\YourName\Downloads
    • Mac: ~/Downloads
    • Chromebook: Files app
  3. Double-click the file to open it
  4. The file opens with your default application

docs.title: File Types and Default Applications
docs.text:
• PDF: PDF reader (Adobe, browser, or other)
  • Word (.docx): Microsoft Word or Google Docs
  • Excel (.xlsx): Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
  • Images (.jpg, .png): Image viewer or browser
  • Video: Media player (VLC, Windows Media Player, etc.)
  • ZIP: Archive tool (Windows, Mac, or extraction software)

docs.title: Verify Downloaded Files
docs.text:
Check that your file downloaded completely:

  1. In your Downloads folder, check the file size
  2. Compare to the size shown in MOS (if displayed)
  3. If sizes don't match, re-download the file
  4. Scan downloaded files with antivirus software if from untrusted sources

docs.title: Download button doesn't work
docs.text:
Symptoms: Clicking download does nothing

How to Fix:

  1. Refresh the page and try again
  2. Try a different browser
  3. Check your browser's pop-up blocker (some block downloads)
  4. Disable browser extensions temporarily and try again
  5. Check your internet connection

Common Causes:

  • Browser compatibility issue
  • Browser security settings
  • Network interruption
  • File temporarily unavailable

docs.title: Permission denied or file not accessible
docs.text:
Symptoms: Error message says you don't have permission or the file doesn't exist

How to Fix:

  1. Verify you have access to the item (news, assessment, folder, etc.)
  2. Check your group membership and permissions
  3. Contact your administrator if you believe you should have access
  4. Try logging out and back in

Common Causes:

  • You don't have access to the group or subgroup
  • Your role doesn't include access to this item
  • File was removed or deleted
  • Sharing link expired

docs.title: File missing or deleted
docs.text:
Symptoms: The download link appears but the file is gone

How to Fix:

  1. Contact your administrator to confirm file location
  2. Ask if the file was archived or moved
  3. Request a new copy if it was recent
  4. Check if there's a backup version available

Common Causes:

  • File was deleted from library
  • File was moved to a different folder
  • Sharing link expired
  • File storage limit exceeded

docs.title: Slow or incomplete download
docs.text:
Symptoms: Download takes very long or stops before completing

How to Fix:

  1. Check your internet connection speed
  2. Try downloading again
  3. Switch from mobile data to Wi-Fi
  4. Use a wired connection instead of wireless
  5. Close other applications using bandwidth
  6. Try downloading at a different time

Common Causes:

  • Slow internet connection
  • Network congestion
  • Large file size
  • Browser timeout

docs.title: Browser warns about unsafe file
docs.text:
Symptoms: Browser shows "This file is unsafe" or similar warning

How to Fix:

  1. This is usually a false positive if the file came from MOS
  2. Click Keep or Download anyway to proceed
  3. Scan the file with antivirus software
  4. If you're concerned, ask your administrator about the file
  5. Never open unknown files from untrusted sources

Common Causes:

  • Executable files (.exe, .zip) may trigger warnings
  • Browser being overly cautious
  • File actually contains malware (rare from MOS)

docs.title: Tips and Best Practices
docs.text:
• ✅ Check file size before downloading on limited connections
  • ✅ Verify downloaded files are what you expected
  • ✅ Scan downloaded files with antivirus if concerned
  • ✅ Organize downloads into folders (Documents, Projects, etc.)
  • ✅ Keep important downloads backed up in another location
  • ❌ Don't open unexpected files from unknown sources
  • ❌ Don't ignore antivirus warnings
  • ❌ Don't download files if you don't recognise their source

docs.title: Groups and Associations
docs.text:
Reference

Understanding organizational structure in Match Official System

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: In Match Official System, a group (or association) is the logical boundary that defines a community of users who officiate a specific sporting code or organization.

docs.title: What Is a Group/Association?
docs.text:
A group is:

  • A sporting organization - Represents a league, federation, association, or governing body for a particular sport
  • A logical boundary for users - Contains all officials, administrators, reviewers, and other members who work for that organization
  • A container for resources - Holds news, assessments, training materials, library files, and reports specific to that organization
  • A permission scope - Controls who can see what data and features based on their role and group membership

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Common examples of groups/associations:

  • Football/Soccer league
  • Rugby union or rugby league organization
  • Cricket association
  • Tennis federation
  • Basketball league
  • Netball association
  • Water polo federation

docs.title: Organizational Structure
docs.text:
Groups can have a hierarchical structure with subgroups:

  • Parent group - The main organization (e.g., National Football League)
  • Subgroups - Divisions, regions, or sections within the parent (e.g., Northern Division, Southern Division)

Members can belong to the parent group and/or specific subgroups. Administrators can organize users into subgroups based on geography, competition level, or other criteria.

docs.title: Data Visibility
docs.text:
• You only see news, announcements, and reports from your group and subgroups
  • You can only interact with users who are members of your group or shared subgroups
  • Your assessments and diaries are scoped to your group

docs.title: Features and Settings
docs.text:
• Group administrators control which features are enabled (e.g., whether News notifications are available)
  • Settings such as the calendar start date, time zone, and quick links are configured per group
  • Theme and branding can be customised per group

docs.title: Access Levels and Roles
docs.text:
• Your access level (User or Owner) and roles (Viewer, Reviewer, Trainer, Communications, Files Manager) are specific to each group
  • You might have different roles in different groups
  • For example, you could be an Owner in one group but have only the Reviewer role in another

docs.text:

  • Membership and Roles - Manage group members and permissions (Owner access required)
  • Admin: Group Settings - Configure group settings and appearance (Owner access required)

docs.text:

docs.title: Levels of Access
docs.text: Match Official System uses a flexible role-based permission system. Users are assigned an access level (User or Owner) plus any combination of specific roles. This allows fine-grained control over what each person can do.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Access is controlled through two components:

  1. Access Level: Either User (standard member) or Owner (full administrator)
  2. Roles: Specific permissions that can be combined as needed

A person can have multiple roles at once. For example, someone could be a Reviewer and a Trainer, giving them permissions from both roles.

docs.title: User
docs.text:
Description: Standard member access with personal workspace

Permissions:

  • Create diary and plan entries
  • Search users in their group(s)
  • Sit exams
  • Access personal user folder (if enabled)
  • Upload files to personal user folder

docs.title: Owner
docs.text:
Description: Full administrative control of the group

Permissions:

  • All User permissions
  • Create, edit, and delete user accounts
  • Modify group settings
  • Modify assessment templates
  • Manage exam questions and answers
  • Manage news and announcements
  • Full access to all folders and files
  • Assign roles to other members

docs.title: Roles
docs.text: Roles grant specific permissions and can be combined. A user can have multiple roles assigned.

docs.title: Viewer
docs.text:
Viewer

Permissions:

  • Create assessments (match day, media, season, general review) on other users
  • View assessment lists and history
  • View subgroup folders they are assigned to (read-only)

docs.title: Reviewer
docs.text:
Reviewer

Permissions:

  • Review diary and plan entries that are awaiting review
  • Provide feedback on shared assessments
  • Run reports on the group
  • View assessment lists (but cannot create assessments without Viewer role)
  • View subgroup folders they are assigned to (read-only)

docs.title: Trainer
docs.text:
Trainer

Permissions:

  • Access the Exam Management section
  • Create, edit, and manage exams
  • Export exam results
  • View exam completion activity

Note

The Trainer role is only available at the group level, not subgroup level.

docs.title: Communications
docs.text:
Communications

Permissions:

  • Access the News Management section
  • Create, edit, and publish news articles
  • Manage news distribution

Note

The Communications role is only available at the group level, not subgroup level.

docs.title: Files Manager
docs.text:
Files Manager

Permissions:

  • Create and delete folders
  • Upload and delete files in group and subgroup folders
  • Move and rename files and folders
  • Generate share links for files

docs.title: Common Role Combinations
docs.text:
Here are some typical ways roles are combined:

Person Type Access Level Roles Regular member User None Coach who reviews diaries User Reviewer Coach who creates assessments and reviews User Viewer + Reviewer Exam coordinator User Trainer News publisher User Communications File administrator User Files Manager Group administrator Owner (has all permissions)

docs.title: Understanding Folder Access
docs.text: Folder permissions depend on your access level and roles.

docs.title: Folder access for Users
docs.text:
• Access only to personal folder: User/{username} (if enabled)
  • Upload and delete files only inside personal folder
  • Cannot access group or subgroup folders

docs.title: Folder access for Viewers
docs.text:
• Can view subgroup folders they are assigned to (read-only)
  • Cannot upload, create, or delete files outside personal folder

docs.title: Folder access for Reviewers
docs.text:
• Same as Viewer - can view subgroup folders they are assigned to (read-only)
  • Reviewer role is for reviewing diary and plan entries, not file management

docs.title: Folder access for Files Managers
docs.text:
• Can create, rename, move, and delete folders and files
  • Can generate share links
  • Full file management within their assigned areas

docs.title: Folder access for Owners
docs.text:
• Full folder control across the group and all subgroups
  • Can manage all files and folders
  • Can generate share links for any file

docs.title: Typical folder layout
docs.text:
Home/
├── user/                   (personal user folders, if enabled)
│   ├── john.smith/
│   ├── jane.doe/
│   └── ...
├── subgroups/              (if enabled)
│   ├── Northern Division/
│   ├── Southern Division/
│   └── ...
├── Documents/
├── Photos/
└── Resources/

docs.title: Can I upload files?
docs.text:
• User (no roles): Only to your personal folder
  • Viewer: Only to your personal folder
  • Reviewer: Only to your personal folder (Reviewer is for assessments, not files)
  • Files Manager: To all assigned folders
  • Owner: To all group and subgroup folders

docs.title: Can I delete files?
docs.text:
• User (no roles): Only files you created in your personal folder
  • Viewer: No
  • Reviewer: No
  • Files Manager: Yes, in assigned areas
  • Owner: Yes, any file in any folder

docs.title: Can I review assessments?
docs.text:
• User (no roles): No
  • Viewer: No (can create assessments, not review them)
  • Reviewer: Yes, for assessments awaiting review
  • Owner: Yes, all assessments

docs.title: Can I create exams?
docs.text:
• User (no roles): No (can only sit exams)
  • Viewer: No
  • Reviewer: No
  • Trainer: Yes
  • Owner: Yes

docs.title: Can I publish news?
docs.text:
• User (no roles): No
  • Viewer: No
  • Reviewer: No
  • Communications: Yes
  • Owner: Yes

docs.title: Can I run reports?
docs.text:
• User (no roles): No
  • Viewer: No
  • Reviewer: Yes
  • Owner: Yes

docs.title: Can I manage users?
docs.text:
• User (any roles): No
  • Owner: Yes, full user management

docs.title: Requesting Additional Roles
docs.text:
If you need additional permissions:

  1. Contact your group administrator (Owner)
  2. Explain what tasks you need to perform
  3. They can assign the appropriate roles in Membership and Roles

docs.title: Folders
docs.text:
Access Level

All users. Note however some permissions are controlled by your group administrator(s).

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Folders page is the full-featured file manager for your group's storage. Use it to upload, organize, rename, move, and delete files and folders. For read-only assessment, news and profile picture browsing, see Media.

Capabilities:

  • Create folders and subfolders
  • Upload single or multiple files
  • Rename files and folders
  • Move items between folders
  • Generate secure, time-limited share links
  • Download files (and folders if ZIP download is enabled)
  • Delete files and folders

Permissions:

  • Access varies by role and subgroup.
  • Owners can manage all content; Users typically manage their own uploads.

docs.title: Understanding Folder Access
docs.text: Access to folders is controlled by your user role and group membership. Different roles have different permissions.

docs.title: Access by Role
docs.text:
User Level:

  • Can access and upload to their own personal user folder (User/{your username})
  • Cannot create or delete folders outside their personal folder
  • Cannot delete files outside their personal folder
  • Can only see files they created in their personal folder

Viewer Level:

  • Can access personal user folder (if enabled)
  • Can view and download files from subgroup folders if assigned to those subgroups
  • Cannot upload to subgroup folders
  • Cannot create or delete folders

Reviewer Level:

  • Can access personal user folder (if enabled)
  • Can view and download files from subgroup folders they are assigned to (read-only)
  • Cannot upload to group or subgroup folders
  • Cannot create or delete folders

Files Manager Level:

  • Can access personal user folder (if enabled)
  • Can view, upload, and download files from all group and subgroup folders
  • Can create, rename, move, and delete folders
  • Can delete files
  • Can generate share links for any file

Owner Level:

  • Full access to all folders in the group and subgroups
  • Can create folders at any level
  • Can delete folders and files at any level
  • Can move files between folders
  • Can generate share links for any file
  • Unrestricted file management

docs.title: Special Folders
docs.text:
Your group may have special folders depending on configuration:

User Folder:

  • Located at the root level: User/{username}
  • Your personal storage space (if enabled by the group)
  • Only you can upload and delete files here
  • Others cannot access your personal folder

Subgroups Folder:

  • Shows team, regional, or division subfolders (if enabled)
  • Access depends on your subgroup membership
  • Viewers and Reviewers can view these folders (read-only)
  • Files Managers and Owners can upload, delete, and manage files

docs.title: Breadcrumb
docs.text:
• Shows the current path, e.g., Home > Documents > 2024 > Reports.
  • Click any level to jump there.
  • Use Up to go one level up; Home to return to root.

docs.title: Toolbar
docs.text:
• New Folder: Create a folder in the current path.
  • Upload Files: Choose files or drag-and-drop into the grid.
  • Refresh: Reload the current folder view.
  • Download Selected: Download selected files; folders may download as ZIP (if enabled).
  • Share: Create a temporary share link for the selected file.
  • Rename: Rename the selected file or folder.
  • Move: Move selected items to a different folder.
  • Delete: Permanently delete selected items.

docs.title: File Grid
docs.text:
• Columns: Select, Type, Name, Size, Modified, Actions.
  • Sort by clicking column headers; folders typically list before files.
  • Right-click an item for a context menu (Open, Download, Rename, Move, Delete, Properties).

docs.title: Navigating Folders
docs.text:
• Double-click a folder to open it.
  • Use breadcrumb segments to jump to any level.
  • Use the browser Back button to return while preserving selection state.

Typical structure:

Home/
├── assessments/
│   ├── 2024/
│   │   └── 12/
│   ├── 2025/
│   │   └── 12/
│   └── 2026/
│       └── 01/
├── news/
│   └── attachments/
└── profile/

docs.title: Creating Folders
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the desired parent folder.
  2. Click New Folder.
  3. Enter a name (avoid / \ : * ? " < > |).
  4. Click Create.

Results: The folder is created in the current location. You may automatically navigate into it depending on configuration.

Naming tips:

  • ✅ 2025-Season-Reports, Training Materials
  • ❌ Reports/2025, Data:Files, very long names

docs.title: Upload Button
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the destination folder.
  2. Click Upload Files.
  3. Select one or multiple files.
  4. Click Upload.

docs.title: Drag-and-Drop
docs.text:
• Drag files from your computer into the grid to upload.

During upload:

  • A progress bar shows overall and per-file progress.
  • Large files may take longer; Wi-Fi recommended.

Limits and requirements:

  • Typical per-file limit: 10-50 MB (varies by group).
  • Allowed types: Most standard document, image, video, and archive formats.
  • Blocked types: Executables (.exe), certain scripts, or flagged files.

If a name collision occurs:

  • Choose Overwrite, Keep Both (auto-renamed), or Skip.

docs.title: Rename
docs.text:
1. Select a file/folder.
  2. Click Rename.
  3. Edit the name (keep extensions unchanged), then save.

docs.title: Download
docs.text:
• Select a file and click Download.
  • For multiple files, use Download Selected; may create a ZIP.

docs.title: Properties
docs.text: • Open the context menu → Properties to view size, type, dates, uploaded-by, and (if applicable) share link status.

docs.title: Share Links
docs.text:
Share links provide temporary access to a single file without requiring MOS login.

  1. Select one file and click Share.
  2. Choose expiration: 1, 7, or 30 days.
  3. Generate and copy the link.
  4. Send via email or message.

Security:

  • Links are hard to guess and expire automatically.
  • Revocation may require an Owner to intervene.

Best practices:

  • ✅ Use the shortest expiration required.
  • ❌ Avoid posting links publicly.

docs.title: Deleting Items
docs.text:
1. Select one or more files/folders.
  2. Click Delete.
  3. Confirm the permanent deletion.

Deleting folders removes all contents recursively. Consider downloading an archive first if needed.

docs.title: Moving Files and Folders
docs.text:
1. Select items and click Move.
  2. Choose the destination in the folder tree.
  3. Click Move Here.

Notes:

  • You cannot move a folder into itself or its descendants.
  • Conflicts prompt for overwrite, skip, or rename.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Plan a clear and consistent folder structure.
  • Use meaningful file names with dates or versions.
  • Archive older content to reduce clutter.
  • Prefer share links over email attachments.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Upload fails: Check size/type limits, try smaller batches, or a different browser; contact an Owner if storage is full.
  • Missing files: Refresh, verify path, clear filters, or confirm permissions.
  • Share link issues: Ensure it hasn’t expired and the file wasn’t moved/deleted.
  • Permission denied: Ask an Owner to adjust your access.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• ✅ Organise by season, project, or assessment.
  • ✅ Use breadcrumbs to jump quickly.
  • ✅ Clean up duplicates and old versions regularly.

docs.title: Media: View Files from Your Features
docs.text:
Access Level

All users

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Media page is a read-only browser for viewing files and media attached to assessments, news articles, and other system features. This is not a file upload area - it shows media that's been attached to items throughout the system such as:

  • Assessment evidence - Photos, videos, or documents attached to your assessments
  • News attachments - Files included with news articles
  • Profile pictures - Member profile images
  • Assessment templates - Documents linked to assessment reviews
  • Other media associated with features

How to Access: Click Library then Media

What You Can Do:

  • Browse media and files in a hierarchical folder structure
  • View file details (name, size, type, date)
  • Download individual files
  • Generate secure share links for files
  • Navigate to related assessments
  • (Administrators) Clean up unused profile images

What You Cannot Do:

  • ❌ Upload new files (attach files directly to the feature instead - assessments, news, etc.)
  • ❌ Create new folders
  • ❌ Delete or rename files
  • ❌ Move files between folders

docs.title: Understanding the Structure
docs.text:
Media appears in the Media browser when:

  1. Files are attached to assessments (evidence, photos, documents)
  2. Files are attached to news articles
  3. Profile pictures are uploaded by users
  4. Content is shared as part of assessment feedback or reviews

These files are organized by feature type and association, not by direct uploads to a "media folder."

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
Breadcrumb Bar:

  • Shows your current location (e.g., Home > Assessments > 2024)
  • Click any segment to jump to that level
  • Use Up (⬆️) to go up one level
  • Click Home (🏠) to return to the top

docs.title: Viewing Folders
docs.text:
1. Double-click a folder to open it
  2. Or click the folder name and press Enter
  3. Contents load showing files and subfolders
  4. Breadcrumb updates to show your location

docs.title: Viewing Files
docs.text:
File Information:

  • Name: Full filename with extension (e.g., match-report-2024.pdf)
  • Size: File size in KB, MB, or GB
  • Date Modified: When the file was last updated
  • Type Icon: Visual indicator of file type (📄 document, 🖼️ image, 🎥 video, etc.)

File Types You Might See:

  • Documents: PDF, DOCX, DOC, TXT, RTF
  • Spreadsheets: XLSX, XLS, CSV
  • Presentations: PPTX, PPT
  • Images: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP, SVG
  • Videos: MP4, AVI, MOV, WMV
  • Archives: ZIP, RAR
  • Others: Various file types your group has attached

Sorting:

  • Click column headers to sort (Name, Size, Date Modified)
  • Click again to reverse order (ascending ↑ / descending ↓)
  • Folders typically appear before files

docs.title: Empty Folders
docs.text:
If a folder shows "No items in this folder":

  • The folder exists but has no files yet
  • No media has been attached to that feature
  • Or you may not have permission to view all content

docs.title: Single File Download
docs.text:
1. Click the file name
  2. Your browser's download dialog appears
  3. Choose save location or accept default (Downloads folder)
  4. Click Save or Download
  5. Result: File downloads to your computer

docs.title: Browser Download Behavior
docs.text:
• Chrome: Auto-downloads to Downloads folder
  • Firefox: Asks where to save or uses Downloads folder
  • Edge: Auto-downloads or asks, depending on settings
  • Safari: Opens download dialog or saves automatically

For Large Files (over 10 MB):

  • Allow extra time for download to complete
  • Use Wi-Fi rather than mobile data if possible
  • Do not close your browser until download finishes

After Downloading:

  1. Check your browser's Downloads folder
  2. Open the file with appropriate software
  3. The file is a copy; original remains in the Media browser

docs.title: Troubleshooting Downloads
docs.text:
Download button doesn't work:

  1. Refresh the page and try again
  2. Try a different browser
  3. Check if browser pop-up blocker is enabled
  4. Disable browser extensions temporarily

Permission denied error:

  1. Verify you have access to the item (news, assessment, etc.)
  2. Check your group membership
  3. Log out and back in
  4. Contact your administrator if access should be granted

File missing:

  1. File may have been removed
  2. Sharing link may have expired
  3. Contact your administrator

docs.title: Create a Share Link
docs.text:
Share links allow you to provide access to specific files without requiring recipients to sign in.

How to Create:

  1. Select the file you want to share (click once to highlight)
  2. Click the Share button in the toolbar
  3. Share Link Modal opens

Choose Link Expiration:

  • 1 Day: Link expires after 24 hours
  • 7 Days: Link expires after one week (recommended)
  • 30 Days: Link expires after one month
  1. Click Generate Link or Create Share Link
  2. A unique URL is generated
  3. Click Copy to Clipboard or manually copy the URL

docs.title: Sharing the Link
docs.text:
• Paste into email, chat, or message
  • Recipients click the link to download the file
  • No MOS account required (during validity period)
  • Link expires automatically after the chosen period

What Recipients See:

  • Download page with file name and size
  • Download button to get the file
  • Expiration date
  • No access to other files or your library

Security Best Practices:

  • ✅ Use shortest expiration that meets your needs
  • ✅ Only share links with intended recipients
  • ✅ Avoid posting links publicly
  • ✅ Generate new link rather than re-sharing old ones
  • ❌ Don't share links in public forums or social media

docs.title: Revoking Links
docs.text:
If you need to revoke a link before expiration:

  • Contact your administrator
  • They can manually revoke specific links
  • Link immediately becomes invalid

docs.title: View Assessment Evidence
docs.text:
Some folders in Media contain files linked to assessments:

How to Find:

  1. Navigate to the assessments folder in Media
  2. Look for a View Assessment link or button
  3. Click to open the full assessment with all details and evidence

What You'll See:

  • Original assessment details
  • Reviewer feedback (if reviewed)
  • All attached media (photos, videos, documents)
  • Rating scales and comments

Downloading Evidence:

  1. Open the assessment
  2. Look for attachment links or download buttons
  3. Click to download the file
  4. Results appear in your Downloads folder

docs.title: Profile Images Cleanup

Access Level

docs.title: Unused Profile Images
docs.text:
Over time, your MOS group may accumulate profile images for users who no longer exist or have changed their profile picture multiple times, leaving orphaned image files.

What This Tool Does:

  • Scans the media library for profile image files
  • Identifies images not currently assigned to any user profile
  • Allows bulk deletion of these orphaned images

Access the Tool:

  1. Navigate to Library → Media
  2. (Admins only) Admin Tools panel appears
  3. Click Profile Images Cleanup or Clean Unused Profile Images

Review Orphaned Images:

  1. A list of unused profile images appears:

    • Image thumbnail
    • File name
    • File size
    • Upload date
    • "Not in use" indicator

  2. Select images to delete (checkboxes)

  3. Or Select All to delete all unused images

Delete Images:

  1. Click Delete Selected or Remove Unused Images
  2. Confirmation prompt appears: "Are you sure? This cannot be undone."
  3. Confirm to permanently delete

Results:

  • Selected images are removed from the media library
  • Storage space is freed
  • No impact on current user profiles (only orphaned files are removed)
  • Success message shows how many images were deleted

When to Use:

  • Storage space is running low
  • Performing regular media library maintenance
  • After bulk user deletions or profile migrations
  • To clean up old test accounts

Caution:

  • ⚠️ Deletion is permanent - images cannot be recovered
  • ⚠️ Ensure images are truly orphaned before deleting
  • ⚠️ If in doubt, do not delete - orphaned images don't cause harm
  • ⚠️ Consider downloading a backup before bulk deleting

Tips:

  • ✅ Run cleanup quarterly or annually as part of maintenance
  • ✅ Review list carefully before bulk delete
  • ✅ Only delete if storage is a concern; orphaned images are harmless
  • ❌ Don't delete images that might be in use elsewhere (linked in news, assessments, etc.)

docs.title: Can't See Expected Files
docs.text:
Problem: Files or folders are missing from the media library

Solutions:

  1. Check Your Location:

    • Verify you're in the correct folder (check breadcrumb)
    • Navigate to parent folder and look for subfolder

  2. Refresh the View:

    • Click Refresh button to reload folder contents
    • Files may have been added since you opened the page

  3. Permissions:

    • You may not have permission to view certain folders or files
    • Contact your administrator if you think you should have access

  4. Subgroup Visibility:

    • Some files may be restricted to specific subgroups
    • Check with administrator about subgroup assignments

  5. Files May Be in Folders (not Media):

    • Media is read-only view; some content may only be in Folders page
    • Try Library → Folders instead

docs.title: Download Doesn't Start
docs.text:
Problem: Clicking download doesn't download the file

Solutions:

  1. Browser Blocked Download:

    • Check browser's download/popup blocker
    • Allow downloads from MOS domain
    • Try again

  2. File Too Large:

    • Large files may time out
    • Try a wired connection or better Wi-Fi
    • Contact admin if file is too large for normal download

  3. Browser Compatibility:

    • Try a different browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)
    • Update your current browser to latest version

  4. Network Issues:

    • Check your internet connection
    • Try again later if network is slow

docs.title: Share Link Doesn't Work
docs.text:
Problem: Generated share link shows error or doesn't load

Solutions:

  1. Link Expired:

    • Check expiration date
    • Generate a new link if needed

  2. Link Copied Incorrectly:

    • Ensure entire URL was copied (check for truncation)
    • Re-copy from share modal

  3. Permissions Changed:

    • File may have been deleted or moved
    • Permissions may have been revoked
    • Generate new link

  4. Recipient Issues:

    • Recipient may have network/browser issues
    • Ask them to try different browser or device

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
For All Users:

  • ✅ Use breadcrumb navigation to jump between folders quickly
  • ✅ Sort by Date Modified to find recent uploads
  • ✅ Generate short-lived share links (1-7 days) for better security

docs.title: About Match Official System Licensing
docs.text: Match Official System is an annual subscription service provided by Cortana Design. Associations and organisations purchase annual (or seasonal) licences to use the system, which includes access for all members and features.

docs.title: Pricing
docs.text:
Annual subscription pricing ranges from approximately $500 to $1,500 AUD per year (or per season), depending on factors such as:

  • Number of users in your organisation
  • Number of subgroups you require
  • Feature packages selected

docs.title: How Users and Subgroups Are Priced
User Licensing
docs.text:
Users are purchased in blocks of 50

  • Minimum: 50 users
  • Additional blocks can be purchased as needed
  • Covers all members who need access to the system
  • All members with any role count towards this limit

docs.title: Subgroup Licensing
docs.text:
Subgroups are purchased in blocks of 5

  • Minimum: 5 subgroups (or the subscription includes a base allocation)
  • Additional blocks can be purchased for more divisions/regions/teams
  • Each subgroup helps organise members and control feature access
  • Allows targeting of news, resources and assessments

docs.title: Included Features
docs.text:
All features except subgroup enhancements are available with your subscription:

  • ✅ Dashboard and personal workspace
  • ✅ Profile management
  • ✅ News and announcements
  • ✅ Assessments and reviews
  • ✅ Exams and question banks
  • ✅ File storage and library
  • ✅ Media management
  • ✅ Reporting and analytics
  • ✅ User management (Owners only)
  • ✅ Group settings and configuration
  • ✅ Assessment templates
  • ✅ Email notifications

docs.title: Subgroup Enhancements
docs.text:
Subgroup-related features:

  • Create and organise subgroups
  • Target news to specific subgroups
  • Assign users to subgroups
  • Control access based on subgroup membership
  • Organise assessments by subgroup
  • Generate subgroup-specific reports

docs.title: Determining User Count
docs.text:
Count all members who need access:

  • Match officials who create and submit assessments
  • Reviewers who assess and provide feedback
  • Administrators who manage the system
  • Support staff who may need read-only access
  • New members who will join during the subscription period

Plan for growth: purchase additional user blocks if you expect to grow during the subscription year.

docs.title: Determining Subgroup Count
docs.text:
Consider your organisational structure:

  • No subgroups: One flat organisation
  • By region: Regional divisions (e.g. North, South, East, West)
  • By level: Competitive levels (e.g. Professional, Semi‑Professional, Amateur)
  • By sport/code: Different sports within one organisation
  • By committee: Management committees with different roles
  • Hybrid: A mix of different organisational structures

Example: A state-level sporting body with 5 regions might purchase:

  • 150 users (3 blocks of 50)
  • 10 subgroups (2 blocks of 5) for regions and central administration

docs.title: Annual Renewal
docs.text:
• Subscriptions are annual, aligned with your financial year or season
  • Renewal costs depend on updated user and subgroup counts
  • Plan ahead to adjust licences before renewal
  • Contact Cortana Design for renewal and modifications

docs.title: Adjusting User Counts

If you need more users:

docs.title: Adjusting Subgroup Counts

  • Existing subgroups can be reorganised without additional cost
  • Removed subgroups don't reduce the subscription cost

docs.title: Invoice and Billing

  • Contact Cortana Design for billing enquiries

docs.title: Support and Assistance

For questions about your subscription:

  • Reach out to Cortana Design directly
  • Check this documentation for feature explanations

docs.title: Change Your Name
docs.text:
Access Level

All authenticated users

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Update your first name and last name in the Match Official System. When you change your name, your username also updates automatically.

docs.title: How to Access
docs.text: Click My Account then Change Name

docs.title: Before You Start
docs.text:
What Happens To Password Recovery

If you have a secret question and answer configured on your account they will be retained when you change your name. You can continue to use the Forgot Password process as before.

What This Means

  • If you have a secret question and answer: You can continue to use the Forgot Password process.
  • Social (external) login accounts: Accounts managed by an external identity provider may not support secret question/answer recovery — follow the message shown on the Forgot Password page.
  • Administrators can reset passwords: Association administrators can still reset passwords for any account.

docs.title: How to Change Your Name
docs.text:
1. Navigate to My Account then Change Name
  2. The Change Your Name page opens
  3. Enter your new First Name
  4. Enter your new Last Name
  5. Read the information note about password recovery
  6. Click Save Changes
  7. Confirmation message appears
  8. Result: Your name is updated immediately

docs.title: Field Requirements
docs.text:
First Name

  • Required field
  • Must contain only letters, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes
  • First letter of each word is automatically capitalised
  • Examples: John, Mary-Ann, Jean-Pierre

Last Name

  • Required field
  • Must contain only letters, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes
  • First letter of each word is automatically capitalised
  • Examples: Smith, O'Brien, Van Der Berg

Validation

The system automatically:

  • Capitalises the first letter of each word
  • Accepts hyphens in names like Mary-Ann
  • Accepts apostrophes in names like O'Brien
  • Accepts spaces in names like Van Der Berg

docs.title: What Happens When You Change Your Name
docs.text:
Name Updates

  • First name updates in your profile
  • Last name updates in your profile
  • Full name displays as First Last everywhere in the system

Username Updates

  • New username generates automatically
  • Format: firstname.surname
  • All lowercase
  • Removes spaces, hyphens and apostrophes
  • Examples: john.smith, maryann.obrien, jeanpierre.vanderberg

Username Conflicts

If your new username already exists:

  • A number is added to make it unique
  • Format: firstname.surname1, firstname.surname2, etc.
  • You are notified of your new username

Password Recovery

  • If you have a secret question/answer configured it remains available and you can use the Forgot Password process.
  • If you use a social/external login the Forgot Password page will explain how to proceed.
  • Administrators can still reset your password for you.

Email Notification

You receive an email confirming:

  • Your new name
  • Your new username
  • Note: the confirmation email shows your updated information but does not always indicate whether password recovery remains enabled; check your account or contact your administrator if unsure

Session Updates

  • Your name updates immediately in the current session
  • Top right corner shows your new name
  • Username updates for next login

docs.title: Flowchart
docs.text:
Hold "Alt" / "Option" to enable pan & zoom 
flowchart TD
  A[Open Change Name page] --> B[Enter First Name and Last Name]
  B --> C{Are names valid?}
  C -- No --> C1[Show message: use letters, spaces, hyphens, apostrophes]
  C1 --> B
  C -- Yes --> D[Generate new username: firstname.surname]
  D --> D1[Convert to lowercase]
  D1 --> D2[Remove spaces, hyphens, apostrophes]
  D2 --> E{Does this username already exist?}
  E -- No --> F[Use generated username]
  E -- Yes --> G[Add a number to make it unique]
  F --> H[Secret question retained]
  G --> H
  H --> I[Update your profile name]
  I --> J[Send confirmation email]
  J --> K[Update session: top-right name changes]
  K --> L[Result: Name updated immediately]
  L --> M[Next login: use your new username]
  H --> N[If social/external account: follow Forgot Password guidance]

docs.title: After Changing Your Name
docs.text:
Next Login

When you log in next time:

  1. Use your new username
  2. Use your current password (unchanged)
  3. Log in as normal

If You Forget Your Password

  1. Contact your association administrator
  2. They can reset your password for you
  3. You will receive an email with a new temporary password

If You Want to Change Password Recovery Settings

Password recovery cannot be re-enabled after a name change. This is a security measure to protect your account.

docs.title: Example 1: Simple Name Change
docs.text:
Current Name: John Smith Current Username: john.smith

Change to: Jonathan Smith

Result:

  • Name: Jonathan Smith
  • Username: jonathan.smith
  • Email sent confirming the change

docs.title: Example 2: Name Change with Hyphen
docs.text:
Current Name: Mary Smith Current Username: mary.smith

Change to: Mary-Ann Smith

Result:

  • Name: Mary-Ann Smith
  • Username: maryann.smith
  • Email sent confirming the change

docs.title: Example 3: Name Change with Username Conflict
docs.text:
Current Name: John Williams Current Username: john.williams

Change to: John Smith

System Check: john.smith already exists

Result:

  • Name: John Smith
  • Username: john.smith1
  • Email sent confirming the change
  • Message shows your new username includes a number

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
Before Changing Your Name

  • Make sure you know your current password
  • Consider whether you need the name change
  • Check whether your account uses a social/external login or has a secret question configured; contact your administrator if unsure

After Changing Your Name

  • Write down your new username
  • Test logging out and back in with new username
  • Store your password securely
  • Contact your administrator if you need to reset your password

Password Security

  • Use a strong password you will remember
  • Consider using a password manager
  • Do not share your password
  • Change your password regularly

docs.title: Invalid Name Format
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Error message when entering name
  • Cannot save changes
  • Message about invalid characters

How to Fix

  1. Check your name contains only letters, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes
  2. Remove any numbers or special characters
  3. Remove extra spaces
  4. Try again

Common Causes

  • Numbers in name field
  • Special characters like brackets or commas
  • Extra spaces at start or end

docs.title: Cannot Save Changes
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Save button does not work
  • Page does not respond
  • No confirmation message

How to Fix

  1. Check both first name and last name are filled in
  2. Verify names meet format requirements
  3. Refresh the page
  4. Try again
  5. Clear browser cache if problem persists

Common Causes

  • Empty required fields
  • Invalid characters in names
  • Browser cache issues
  • Session expired

docs.title: Did Not Receive Confirmation Email
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Name changed successfully
  • No email received
  • Cannot confirm new username

How to Fix

  1. Check your spam or junk mail folder
  2. Wait a few minutes for email to arrive
  3. Check email address is correct in your profile
  4. Contact your administrator to confirm your new username

Common Causes

  • Email went to spam folder
  • Email delayed in delivery
  • Incorrect email address on your account

docs.title: Forgot New Username
docs.text:
Symptoms

  • Changed name successfully
  • Cannot remember new username
  • Cannot log in

How to Fix

  1. Check the confirmation email sent when you changed your name
  2. Try firstname.surname format
  3. Try with numbers added if that exists (firstname.surname1)
  4. Contact your administrator to confirm your username

Common Causes

  • Did not note down new username
  • Confirmation email deleted
  • Username had number added due to conflict

docs.title: Change Password: Update Your Login Credentials
docs.text:
Access Level

All authenticated users (Except Social Account Users)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Change your login password to keep your account secure. Your password is managed through Microsoft Azure AD B2C.

Social Account Users

If you signed up with Microsoft, Google, or another social provider, you cannot change your password here. You must change it through your social provider's settings.

How to Access: Click My Account then Change password

docs.title: How to Change Your Password
docs.text:
1. Click My Account → Change password
  2. Enter your Current Password (required)
  3. Enter your New Password (required)
  4. Enter your Confirm Password (required)
  5. Click Save
  6. Result: Success message appears and your password is updated

You will remain logged in after changing your password.

docs.title: Password Fields
docs.text:
Current Password (required)

  • Your existing password
  • Confirms your identity before allowing changes
  • Required for security

New Password (required)

  • Your new desired password
  • Must meet security requirements (see below)
  • Cannot be the same as your current password

Confirm Password (required)

  • Re-enter your new password to prevent typos
  • Must match New Password exactly
  • Case-sensitive

docs.title: Password Requirements
docs.text:
Your new password must meet these criteria:

  • Minimum length: At least 8 characters
  • Uppercase letters: Include at least one (A-Z)
  • Lowercase letters: Include at least one (a-z)
  • Numbers: Include at least one (0-9)
  • Special characters: Recommended (!, @, #, $, %, etc.)

Creating a Strong Password:

  • ✅ Use a unique password for this system
  • ✅ Mix uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters
  • ✅ Avoid personal information (birthdays, names, etc.)
  • ✅ Don't reuse old passwords
  • ✅ Use a password manager to generate and store passwords
  • ✅ Change your password every 90 days

Examples of Strong Passwords:

  • MySecure123!Pass
  • Summer2024@Beach
  • Hockey#Team99

Avoid:

  • ❌ Common words or phrases ("password", "welcome")
  • ❌ Sequential numbers (123456)
  • ❌ Keyboard patterns (qwerty)
  • ❌ Personal information easily found online
  • ❌ Sharing your password with anyone
  • ❌ Reusing passwords from other sites

docs.title: If You Signed Up With Microsoft, Google, or Another Provider
docs.text:
You cannot change your password in Match Official System. Your account uses your social provider's credentials.

To change your password:

  1. Go to your social provider (Microsoft, Google, etc.)
  2. Sign in to your account
  3. Go to Security or Settings
  4. Update your password there
  5. Your new password works everywhere, including Match Official System

Example:

  • Microsoft Account → Go to account.microsoft.com → Security → Change password
  • Google → myaccount.google.com → Security → Password

docs.title: Changing an Expired Password
docs.text:
If your password has expired or an administrator requires you to change it:

  1. You'll be redirected to the Change Password page automatically
  2. Enter your Current Password
  3. Enter a New Password meeting the requirements
  4. Confirm your new password
  5. Click Save
  6. You'll be able to access the system normally

docs.title: Recovering Access After Forgetting Password
docs.text:
1. Go to the login page
  2. Click Forgot my password
  3. Follow the email verification process
  4. Create a new password meeting the requirements
  5. Log in with your new password

docs.title: "Current password incorrect"
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Check that Caps Lock is off
  2. Verify you're typing the password correctly
  3. Try typing it in a text editor first to see what you're entering
  4. If you can't remember your password, use Forgot my password on the login page

docs.title: "New passwords do not match"
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Clear both the New Password and Confirm Password fields
  2. Type your new password carefully in New Password
  3. Type the exact same password in Confirm Password
  4. Make sure there are no extra spaces at the beginning or end
  5. Check that you didn't accidentally turn on Caps Lock

docs.title: "Password does not meet requirements"
docs.text:
How to Fix:

  1. Make sure your password is at least 8 characters long (not 7)
  2. Include at least one uppercase letter (A-Z)
  3. Include at least one lowercase letter (a-z)
  4. Include at least one number (0-9)
  5. Consider adding a special character (!, @, #, $, etc.)

Example of a strong password: MyPassHALO24!

docs.title: If You Signed Up With Microsoft, Facebook, or Another Provider
docs.text:
You cannot change your password in Match Official System. Your account uses your social provider's credentials.

To change your password:

  1. Go to your social provider (Microsoft, Facebook, etc.)
  2. Sign in to your account
  3. Go to Security or Settings
  4. Update your password there
  5. Your new password works everywhere, including Match Official System

Example:

  • Microsoft Account → Go to account.microsoft.com → Security → Change password
  • Facebook → Settings & Privacy → Settings → Security & Login → Change Password
  • Google → myaccount.google.com → Security → Password

docs.title: Password Security
docs.text:
• ✅ Use a different password for this system than other websites
  • ✅ Never share your password with anyone
  • ✅ Don't write your password on sticky notes
  • ✅ Don't save your password in browsers on public computers
  • ✅ Use a password manager to remember complex passwords
  • ✅ Log out from shared computers

docs.title: Account Protection
docs.text:
• ✅ If you see unexpected login activity, change your password immediately
  • ✅ Report suspicious activity to an administrator
  • ✅ Use "Keep me signed in" only on personal devices
  • ✅ Sign out of public computers before leaving

docs.title: Profile: Linked Accounts
docs.text:
Access Level

Authenticated Users Only

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Linked accounts allow you to sign into Match Official System using your Microsoft or Google account in addition to your primary credentials. This provides extra convenience and an additional way to access your account if you forget your password.

What you can do:

  • Link your Microsoft account
  • Link your Google account
  • Unlink accounts at any time
  • Log in with any linked account

docs.title: Why Link Social Accounts?
docs.text:
Convenience

  • Sign in with one click using Microsoft or Google
  • No need to remember another password

Account Recovery

  • If you forget your primary password, you can still sign in with a linked social account
  • Provides backup access to your account

Flexibility

  • Switch between login methods depending on your preference
  • Maintain your primary login method while adding alternatives

docs.title: Linking Microsoft Account
docs.text:
1. Navigate to your profile settings

    • Click your name or avatar in the top navigation bar

    • Choose "My Account" from the dropdown menu

      Alternative navigation

      In the My Account section, you can also select Update Profile from the sidebar.

  2. Find the Linked Accounts section

    • Scroll to "Linked Accounts" or "Connected Accounts"

  3. Click "Link Microsoft Account"

    • The button appears under the Microsoft Account section
    • You'll be redirected to Microsoft's login page

  4. Sign in with your Microsoft account

    • Enter your Microsoft email address
    • Enter your Microsoft password
    • Complete any security verification if requested

  5. Return and confirm

    • You'll be automatically returned to your profile
    • You'll see a confirmation message: "Your Microsoft account has been linked successfully"
    • Microsoft Account now appears as "Linked" in your profile

docs.title: Linking Google Account
docs.text:
The process is the same as Microsoft:

  1. Go to your profile settings (top right of any page)
  2. Find the Linked Accounts section
  3. Click "Link Google Account"
  4. Sign in with your Google account (email and password)
  5. You'll see a confirmation: "Your Google account has been linked successfully"

What Happens When You Link

When you link an account, the system creates a secure connection between your Match Official System account and your Microsoft/Google account. The connection allows you to sign in using either method.

docs.title: How to Log In With a Linked Account
docs.text:
After you've linked an account, you can log in using it:

  1. Go to the Match Official System login page

  2. Instead of entering your email and password, look for:

    • "Sign in with Microsoft" button
    • "Sign in with Google" button

  3. Click the social login button

    • You'll be redirected to Microsoft or Google

    • If you're already signed into Microsoft/Google in your browser.

      Seamless Login

      If you're already logged into your Microsoft or Google account in your browser, you might not need to enter your password again. Just click the social login button and you'll be signed in automatically.

  4. You're signed in!

    • The system recognises your social account is linked to your profile
    • Your session is established with your Match Official System account
    • You have full access with your linked account

docs.title: Unlink Microsoft or Google Account
docs.text:
1. Go to your profile settings

    • Click your name or avatar in the top right
    • Select "My Account"

  2. Find the Linked Accounts section

    • Scroll to your linked accounts
    • Find the account you want to unlink

  3. Click the "Unlink" button

    • The "Unlink" button appears next to each linked account

  4. Confirm in the popup

    • A confirmation window appears: "Are you sure you want to unlink your [Provider] account?"
    • Click "Unlink" to confirm

  5. Confirmation message

    • You'll see: "Your [Provider] account has been unlinked successfully"
    • The account no longer appears as linked in your profile

After Unlinking

After unlinking an account, you will no longer be able to sign in using that social account. You'll need to use your primary password to access Match Official System. Consider changing your password if you may forget it.

docs.title: What Gets Connected?
docs.text:
When you link an account, the system securely connects:

  • Your Match Official System account (your email, password, and user data)
  • Your Microsoft or Google identity (your social account email and ID)

The connection is stored securely in the system's database.

docs.title: Multiple Linked Accounts
docs.text:
You can link both Microsoft and Google accounts to the same Match Official System account:

Your Match Official System Account
    ├─ Primary: Email + Password
    ├─ Linked: Microsoft Account
    └─ Linked: Google Account

You can sign in using any of these three methods.

docs.title: Are My Passwords Shared?
docs.text:
No. Your Match Official System password and your Microsoft/Google passwords are completely separate:

  • Linking does not require you to share your primary password with Microsoft or Google
  • Linking does not give Microsoft or Google access to your Match Official System data
  • Only the system administrator can see the connection exists

docs.title: Can Someone Else Link My Account?
docs.text:
No. Linking requires you to be:

  1. Already signed into your Match Official System account
  2. Able to authenticate with your Microsoft or Google account

No one else can link accounts on your behalf.

docs.title: "Linking succeeds but I can't sign in with that account"
docs.text:
What this means: The account appears as linked in your profile, but the login button doesn't work.

How to fix it:

  1. Try signing out completely and clearing your browser cache
  2. Go back to the login page
  3. Click the social login button again
  4. If the issue persists, contact your system administrator

docs.title: "The system says my social account is already linked"
docs.text:
What this means: You tried to link a social account that's already connected to a different Match Official System account.

How to fix it:

  1. You can only link a social account once per system
  2. If you have multiple accounts, you'll need to decide which one to use
  3. Contact your system administrator if you need to consolidate accounts

docs.title: "I unlinked my account but I still can't log in"
docs.text:
What this means: After unlinking, the social login option is no longer available for you.

How to fix it:

  1. Use your primary email and password to sign in instead
  2. If you forgot your password, use the forgot password flow to reset it
  3. You can link the social account again anytime

docs.title: "Sign in with [Provider] button isn't working"
docs.text:
What this means: The social login method might be temporarily unavailable, or the account isn't properly linked.

How to fix it:

  1. Try refreshing the page
  2. Clear your browser cookies and cache
  3. Make sure you're using the same email address for your social account as your Match Official System account
  4. Try unlinking and relinking the account
  5. Contact your system administrator if the issue continues

docs.title: "I can't find the Linked Accounts section"
docs.text:
Where to look:

  1. Click your name or profile icon in the top navigation
  2. Select "Profile" or "Profile Settings"
  3. Look for a section labeled "Linked Accounts," "Connected Accounts," or "Social Accounts"
  4. It should be on the main profile page or in a security/settings tab

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Choose strong passwords: Your Microsoft and Google passwords should be strong and unique
  • Enable two-factor authentication: Enable 2FA on your Microsoft and Google accounts for extra security
  • Review linked accounts regularly: Periodically check your linked accounts to ensure they're still needed
  • Unlink accounts you don't use: Remove social accounts if you're no longer using them to sign in

docs.title: If You're Concerned About Security
docs.text:
• Change your password: If you suspect someone accessed your account, change your password
  • Unlink all accounts: If you're concerned about social account linking, unlink all accounts and use only your primary password
  • Contact your administrator: Report any suspicious activity to your system administrator

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
Q: Can I link multiple social accounts? A: Yes. You can link both your Microsoft account and your Google account to the same Match Official System account.

Q: If I forget my Microsoft/Google password, can I still access Match Official System? A: Yes. You can still sign in using your primary email and password. Then you can use the forgot password flow if needed.

Q: Can I link the same social account to multiple Match Official System accounts? A: No. Each social account can only be linked to one Match Official System account.

Q: Does linking an account change my password? A: No. Your primary password remains unchanged. Linking just adds another way to sign in.

Q: What happens if I delete my Microsoft/Google account? A: You'll no longer be able to sign in using that social provider. You can still use your primary password to access Match Official System.

Q: Is my account secure if I link social accounts? A: Yes. Linking is secure and only requires authentication from both accounts. Your data remains protected.

Q: Can I link accounts with different email addresses? A: Your linked social account should ideally use the same email address as your Match Official System account, though the system will allow different emails. Emails will however be sent only to your primary B2C local account.

Q: How do I know which accounts are linked? A: Go to your Profile Settings and look at the Linked Accounts section. It shows all currently linked accounts.
